pEi67NwFElznHpB-m9CZXg.review_text: Great live music, small dance floor nice bar. Been here many times I like how lively this place is...

tH8hrIshvkHH_ER68LD2gw.review_text: I recently was at Boom Boom room (only to meet a friend).  the experience was (if this were possible) less enjoyable than my previous time there.  Quality to cost ratio is not very good.  If you factor in inferior service, not recommended when you consider all the other options we have in SF.  Too Bad as when JLH was alive this place was "benchmark".

k9Eyxp8enSJU2l39bW9sjQ.review_text: Very typical S.F.  bar. The best part is the really cool bands playing there, it's a bit too dark and no mojitos!!

zk9T9e23B1mKvnnfyFi89Q.review_text: Without a doubt, this is one of the BEST places to see music in the city.  They have a steller record of bringing in great talent and if you've ever been to Jazzfest (or wanted to go) you can feel that same vibe at BBR.  I have been here for my birthday, for new years, i have hung with local friends, brought out of town guests and wandered in during the Fillmore Jazz Festival.  It always draws a crowd that loves music and its a lot of fun - everyone is cool, its easy to get a drink and the place is always a sure thing for a great time.

qIRbe4J-5OMkIA8V6rdC9A.review_text: One of the finest venues in SF.  These people know how to run a show and not just get you in with flashy ads and cheap drinks.  The sound system here is TOPS, unlike many, many places in SF these days.  I've loved every show I've seen here, from Richie Cunning to the Black Nature Band - the acoustics are quality and everything is crisp so you can actually hear the words, hah.  ROTC (Return of the Cypher) is dope as hell, I go to this whenever I can and love getting up on stage with positive, conscious hip hop.  The crowds are wonderfully diverse with attractive people that you want to get to know better.  Bartenders are always nice and chill and the put some great visuals on the walls with local art and stuff.  It just gives everything that solid local SF vibe.

YfNB5zzdyXclh8eHH_wCtg.review_text: This place is pure San Francisco...great music, eclectic crowd...and What is that smell in the air?  Was here last night. Awesome funky/jazz band made the dancing easy. Cheap strong drinks and they even have a cocktail waitress going around so you don't have to mozy up to the bar if you don't like.   You don't have to be fancy or classy to come in here, yet for some reason this place just seems to ooze cool. Red lights everywhere, leather, and a checkered floor decor.  Next time you are looking for a fun activity on a Friday or Sat night, mozy over the the boom boom room.

wvo6CDYUY6gD6q_iLjmAOQ.review_text: This place smells like vomit. Walked in and ran out.

4Y81J2Tdq5XAnkeYmCZ2ow.review_text: Sometimes my soul gets a little dull and needs a good schluffing. Some soul-polish, you could say. It turns out, the Boom Boom Room is an instant cure. Nothing like some deep bass and buoyant horns to bring me back to life.   My music-guru buddy recommended BBR for a Saturday night birthday escapade, and the Funk Revival Show was absolutely intoxicating. You know that feeling when you walk into a room and this rush of excitement washes over you? It happens at the Boom Boom Room. The place is electric and you can't help catching a few volts.   They've got some tables along one side, a bar along the other, and the rest is open for movin' and groovin', which is highly recommended considering how ridiculously funky the bands are. It gets packed, which is great on the dancefloor, not so great in the ladies restroom. But, all in all, totally doable.  $15 cover is pretty standard here, so plan to make a night of it and you'll surely get your money's worth. For a dreary, weary soul...revival is priceless.

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: A hot spot to listen to the Blues, right next to the Fillmore as well. The BBR has attracted true legends to play inside its intimate space. I had the privilege of seeing John Lee Hooker (the original owner!) play his last gig here a few years ago.  If you like blues or jazz, this is probably my favorite spot to see it all go down.

TRw1R_efLWgLz2URH-IIMQ.review_text: MUSIC: Live Jazz = Awesome chill music  ATMOSPHERE: Super laid back. The bartender was awesome! The place itself isn't the biggest, with tables near the back and the side as well as a stage and a pretty decent size dance floor. Overall, a very 70's feel in the space. Big plus for checkered-tile floors!!  CROWD: Not super crowded at all, then again, we did go on a random Tuesday. Lots of classy people there, with a few who had a drink too many. They were more of a side entertainment than a distraction (You go single dude dancing by himself).

RPD2MK_RJbCY_GFsLAZjig.review_text: LOVE THAT BOOM BOOM...IN THE ROOM...  Always fun never a disappointment. I have been here many times always unplanned and sometimes after going to the kabuki theater. As always gets packed on the weekends...but I will take a crowd for a live band any day and what  would a venue with live music be with out the patrons packing the dance floor...

he8e3P8HFVaNe1OY3oMM_Q.review_text: Great club, but it does get very warm inside.  If they'd just leave the front door open I'd give them 5 starts.

9myAXqIdHyrIxX_ESbuD2Q.review_text: a great little historic music spot with stiff drinks.

Bw39t2MOstV2VPcAOlYbjg.review_text: I was refused entrance because I had a small backpack.  I told them they could look in but they refused.  My husband had already entered and he would not let me in to tell him.   He told me to text him.   How rude.  I will not be back.

4ZRxv6Lga9bj7R6x9HSoJA.review_text: God I love this place. They manage to book so many funky combos and sweet bands and let the shows go nice and late. Bands will regularly finish up at other venues (Fillmore, Independent) and roll over here to sit in and finish out the night. Always a treat.  The Independent and Fillmore are great spots, but I think I'd have to say this is my favorite venue in SF.

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: Drinking, dancing, and bartenders who have got your back. While the Boom Boom Room probably won't be a regular watering hole of mine, an evening of drinks here might almost always guarantee a fun time.  We went to the Boom Boom Room following an event and were looking to continue a merry night of drinks and conversation. I think the night vaguely went like this:  "Oh what's a Boom Boom Ale?" Glurp, glurp, glurp.  Toast! Speech! Chatter, chatter, chatter.   "Oh another Boom Boom ale?" Glurp, glurp, chatter, chatter, glurp, glurp.  "Who bought more Boom Boom ale?" Glurp, glurp, chatter, chatter, glurp, glurp.   "Oh I love this song!!!" Dance for your life.   "Oh I need to go. Let me settle up my tab."  Settle tab.  "Oh I love this song!!!" Dance for your life again.  "Man I'm thirsty again" Ordered another drink and paid with cash.  Drunkenly told bartender to keep the change.  Great bartender reminds me I gave him a twenty.  "Thanks man. You're awesome!"  I'm sure I will be back to the Boom Boom Room.

ZQu4Pw0NtxmQUdwT-DUJNQ.review_text: They have nice live music sometimes.

Myuxc-kYIiIVH43snmVwBQ.review_text: The BBR is the best-sounding smaller room in the City. Come for the music, which these days is mainly 'Nawlins funk with a smattering of blues and soul, or just come for the vibe and the cool staff and crowd.   Dr. Lonnie Smith, Stanton Moore, Eric Lindell and others are known to play here, so keep an eye out - this is a great venue to see these guys.

7XvUlAuIRF9IhWAvlr5U7Q.review_text: This is a great music venue.  Lots of open space, but it's relaxed and intimate enough that you can see a really good show.  I was recently visiting for "That One Guy", a one man band who plays this homemade electronic instrument that he calls "the pipe".  The fact that he does the whole thing alone was amazing in it's own right, but the music and songs were really rockin' too.  The bartenders were fast and attentive, but stick with beer.  Mixed drinks were mildly expensive and weak.  Another insider tip: steer clear of the Boom Boom Ale; it tasted like Bud.

K-NT_xHy7q779oSPLCyvNQ.review_text: Any place that can make me peel off a layer of clothing in front of five of my male coworkers and shake my groove thang has got sumthin' goin' on, I tell you what...  If you think $15 is a steep cover, go home. You're lame. You won't appreciate the acts they have in here, anyway. It's seriously good shit. This is the most comfortable I've felt musically in San Francisco. It ain't Detroit, but it's close.   Seriously soulful music emanates from the Boom Boom Room. Seriously.  Once you get through the door, the drinks are pretty reasonably priced: a nice surprise. Which leads to layers of clothes being peeled off and groove thangs shakin'...   I said LAYERS of clothes...

tIRh_AmxJhUgzoHUBMPnlA.review_text: Mr & I decided to check out the Boom Boom Room.  Per fellow yelpers suggestion we were cash prepared! ^_^ We wanted to see Marva Wright from New Orleans. The show didn't start till past 10 PM. The japanese girl who played the organ was off the hook and Marva's voice was awesome. We even bought her CD.  Place wasn't that big but it was a good size. The staff at the Boom Boom Room were friendly and attentive.

56I-v3n1u94MysqbPmhyNA.review_text: Loving me some Boom Boom! Went here for drinks before Snoop Dog at the Fillmore. Nice, sexy staff, reasonably price as well as strong drinks, live bands it looked like (setting up) and uber clean considering said location can be shakey at times. Super dive and that's what I like about it!

XnhDByXaRwgMVsAjmDRDZg.review_text: Generally, I like this place. However I went in on Friday night 9/19 to see Alphabet Soup and was pretty let down. The headliner didn't come on until 1:15am. My ticket said show starts at 9:30pm. I get it, the opening band may not start until closer to 10 or so, but they were on waaaaaay too long. They were so good I forgot the name of the band! Oh wait that's a lie, for the 2+ hours they played all their songs sounded like one looooong song. When I asked the sound guy at midnight when the headliner was supposed to be on, he said 5 minutes ago? No worries. I let that go, I wasn't here to see the opener, right? So they come off the stage around midnight. It takes them more than an hour to get Alphabet Soup on stage. At 1am, with no band playing, I finally asked the door guy for my money back and he explains that they advertised an opening band and it was out of his hands. OK, well so is this review, it's totally out of my hands! Alphabet soup sounded great for the 2 songs I was able to stay for. None the less was really let down by the lack of professionalism and customer service. I don't blame the door guy for the late band. Although with an unsatisfied customer I think you would do more to listen and hear that I wasn't happy. At least buy me a beer and shut me up until the band starts?  One more note, I wear earplugs to all shows and I can say that your sound guy needs to know when he's got the levels too high. This show was painfully loud and the place wasn't that busy so even with earplugs I was uncomfortable with the sound. I can say this must have been an off night for you guys as I've seen shows there with no issues which is why you got 2 stars. I would avoid a show there at this point due to the poor customer service I received.

ti4lRf8rv9KICw6msOJT0w.review_text: the boom boom room didn't have that much room.  i stopped by here after the fillmore jazz festival for a few beers and some live music. the act playing was high energy and lots of fun.  the beers are served in plastic cups (i think) and go for a relatively reasonable price.  i think after 8pm or so they charged a $5.00 cover.

PNTbcuPX5V81XibwrNzskg.review_text: I have been here a few times lately, so far so good. We went here twice after another show and the band here was as good if not better than the shows we paid to see. Nice staff, this bar has a local feeling- like your at home, or a regular. Good times :)

Zx5Fd5AqWHLZAUosdjMfYg.review_text: Four stars for the club, 1 star for the treatment at the door.  I liked the ambience and I really support having affordable live music venues in our city.  They tried to charge me the $10 cover at a time when free admission was advertised.  I am not taking off a star because eventually when I showed them the ad on their own website on my phone they gave in.  But the door staff was not friendly or apologetic about the mistake in the least.  Friendlier service would be appreciated.

iIn_sZxyyg5yv6jcAzcYFA.review_text: GREAT GREAT GREAT small club.  Friendly bartenders and a great, easy-to-reach location.  Good sound (for a bar) and an easy-to-reach location.

M3uld0eXDNWOR7sYsmgK-A.review_text: Don't say I didn't warn you....This place is THE WORST (Disregard the 1 star it made me)!! Come here if: You want rude service You like weak drinks You hate your ears and want to subject them to the "DJ" You like throwing money out the window You enjoy the smell of vomit I live practically 2 blocks away and will NEVER be back.

hSou1Jz-x9_Vhx5y6Icj4g.review_text: If you're going to advertise that a band starts at 9.30 then try and ensure that is when they start or at least close to...we had to give up and leave when WB still hadn't come on stage by 11.00pm....Wankers

2LIX6kOFFExqPaHy2_kRNA.user_name: Pax, Formerly Known As Rufus D.

m5cBT7OYfn0HM0d-RCsdZQ.review_text: Wow.  A good dive bar with an even better wide open space near the band stage  for easier listening.  My gin/tonic was watered down, although it could have been the fact that the Crown Royal from earlier was still coursing through my veins with a vengeance.  This place has too many nooks and crannies (replete with curtains and the obvious darkness) where a situation could be taken advantage of, but at least the bathrooms were clean.  Always a plus.  I love the bartender here.  She came right over without me having to flail anyone down.    A good blues band was playing last night and when in the right company, it all fuses together.   I'm remembering this place.....an experience :  my first date with W.  hehe

Zl1fJNTzNULZiqBRShxUYA.review_text: You gotta love this place.  I've been about three times.  I was never impressed by the musical acts, but the people-watching to be done, especially at the bar, was amazing.  I don't know whether she still works there four years later, but there used to be this bartender who looked all of fourteen.  Anyway, each time I went, she would be hit on by these really gross old geezers who seemed like regulars.  They were drunk, and she more than held her own.  I respected her, and I respect the place if it attracts bartenders like her.

zy2cNfG4lLE3SlY9p2OL-A.review_text: A strangely curious club at the corner of Geary and Fillmore.  Its location is quite interesting.  The club is technically situated in Japan town, yet, the Boom Boom Room is somehow referred to as a live band club in "The Fillmore" (which seem to me as indicative of being situated in the Western Addition side of the Fillmore).  As you enter into the club, a couple of bouncers welcome you and stamp your wrist upon receiving the $15 cover charge for the evening.  (Amazingly, the bouncers are people-friendly, unlike the wanna-be cool and exclusive bouncers of Soma, NorthBeach and other wanna-be pretentious, but definitely not world-class cosmopolitan hoods.)  The place is dimly lit while the ambiance is definitely retro and quite intimate.  A predominant existence of the 70s lounge chair in faux leatherette finish surrounds the place, while the main door also appears with the same look and finish.  At the end of the lounge a small stage appears where musicians go wild in playing their tunes, serenading the intoxicated crowd who move in trance-like fashion to the beat of each note.  Last Friday night the NOLA-based band's rendition of various SKA tunes drove the elated crowd wild.  It was interesting for me to see how modern urbanites have turned into a robotic group of unconscious homo sapiens, as they swayed in hypnotic motion to the music.  That night, it struck me that rhythmic beat and music is such an integral part of human existence, almost as vital as the need to breathe, to eat, and to procreate.  I enjoyed the company, as I was surrounded by my beloved boxing chums.  Although, I was quite confused initially, as I expected a jazzy and blues type of venue.  The SKA with a metallic twist genre, was quite a surprise, but nevertheless, it was a well-spent evening with kindred friends.

KeckKVgYyq4739Wap3X_Sg.review_text: Stumbled into this place towards the end of the Jazz fest - it was hot and humid inside from all the dancing that was going on. The band rocked the place and at the end of the set... a red curtain descends from the ceiling so they can have some privacy as they pack up they instruments. I am easy to please - the dance floor and the red curtain sold me on this place.

5WlF0WZAnkDcys9zAcWWPg.review_text: The Old Fashioned wasn't bad, but it was definitely not good either. I liked the atmosphere and the bartenders were nice. Easy to find parking. What else... OH, they definitely need to work on air circulation. I'm glad they allowed ins & outs, otherwise I would have suffocated to death on the humidity and recycled air.   If someone awesome was playing I'd definitely go again.

epGQfAOfJ7WzO-10Hg4Yng.review_text: I went here for the first time to see Troy Andrews and had the best time in a very long time.  The place was clean, lit well, friendly and pretty well priced.  It was pretty crowded that night but I still had space to dance which was key - and which I did very very hard.  Plenty of parking around the neighboring blocks, plenty of food around, don't forget they don't take cards!  Boom freaking boom!

oY0RIWGykQK38ZbyBvb44g.review_text: I think there is a lot of truth to what other people are saying about the Boom Boom Room - while I really, really like this venue, when I read what others had to say it reminded me of a few of the reasons why I don't go here often or have been dissatisfied in the past.  It definitely feels very historic, and though I've been here both at night and in the late afternoon, it's always kind of dark and divey and has the same vibe on the inside. The music is really authentic and I like the ambiance - nobody bugs you, the lighting is good and the bartenders and door people are cool. And even though it's a dive, I don't remember it having that bad "cheesy" smell on the inside that you sometimes find in other places.  BUT...the bathroom is absolutely disgusting. I went around 7PM one Sunday night before anyone was really there, and the entire bathroom reeked like stale vomit, even though it didn't look like many (any) people had been through there. I also felt like someone was going to come busting in on me the whole time, as I was hovering, holding my breath, and holding the door. Sucked, because you know what happens the more beer you drink. The more you have to visit the ladies' room! So I ended up only having one drink and leaving.   Thankfully, I hadn't had to pay the $15 cover because on the way in I'd told the door guy that I'd just be in and out, or I would've felt obliged to stay. I've also caught a few drinks here before going to shows at the Fillmore, and have always enjoyed myself. It's a nice way to start the evening, as long as you don't get stuck with the cover.  I'd like it if the bathrooms got revamped and would recommend checking beforehand to see what's going on at the Boom Boom Room before just dropping in, if it's in the evening. That seems like a hefty price to pay just to enter a club, unless you're planning on staying there for the evening.

R9F4ZM7cfN1CM00JkY08Ug.review_text: I am not one to post bad reviews unless I feel others should know .. and YOU SHOULD KNOW!. I don't know what you are doing at the BBR these days but if last night is an indication of who you allow to represent your business .. we will NOT be back. The two 'boys' 'young men' that work your door are rude, mean and racist. Yes, I said racist. My husband is a black man and your doormen would not allow him back in because they said 'your husband doesn't have a stamp'. It was clearly there and we had just come through that door less than an hour before .. they remembered us and stamping us. The 'bald' shorty rude person that wasn't at the door but showed up with his 'Napoleon' syndrome and grabbed my arm when I just said 'my husband' has a stamp .. saw it! So, he, rudely apologized for their racism but at the same time grabbed my arm with strength to tell me 'I said he's good'. I did not raise my voice at all. And I say, racism, because I watched them ALL night long let 'fake wanna be Tupac wearin' kids go in all night long without them checking their stamps at all. And some of them were much darker than my husband and you could see 'their' stamps?. I know you could care less if we come back cause we're just a couple of dollars to you. But if you do care about your reputation .. then you should know .. we won't be back and I promise to make sure none of my friends go there again. Jack's was a good neighborhood live music bar ..but you've now become trash and classless. I bet John Lee Hooker would not like what you've become. Good luck to you. Thankfully there are other live venue choices in our City .. we don't have to go back to yours. (Oh and the system made me give you at least 1 star..I would give you none)

79pQB9ZzROBHxMM0qJaq3g.review_text: Went there for New Year's Eve...it's a cool little spot with a very eclectic mix. Good for an average night out on the town. Bad for the little seating offered and minimal dance room. The bands are always great, though.

j0eBR4rcbtpylG6b47TD7Q.review_text: So what if the place is tiny? So what if the ceiling is low? So what if the acoustics aren't the best?  Let's talk about the FUN FACTOR!  Depending on the band, the number of instruments on stage, and the volume the performers decide to crank it to, some bands may sound better than others. Some bands may sound a bit muffled, but so what? Time after time, I would have a BLAST! The Boom Boom Room lives up to it's name! It's grimy, it can be a bit sleazy (and I mean that in a good way), and it's always cracking! Every time I've been there, it gets packed, but never uncomfortably packed. Plenty of room to dance! And isn't that the whole reason of going to the Boom Boom Room? To get your boom boom on?! LOL...always a good time. Period.

uRKRDIjWBBrMJyuhGC1VLw.review_text: They get points for keeping the decor old school with pictures of the real deal players on the wall. They even have one of Country Pete McGill,who I have played with.Unfortunately,I've seen bad bands here-just collections of players. The stage is decent,much better than most places, with a curtain that moves up and down-this is an undeniable plus to the musicians as part of the entertainment aspect. The jukebox has the authentic blues stuff,no shakey fakey stuff. Beers are too expensive,even at Happy hour at $5. But you know the owner has to make ends meet and appeal to younger generations than Hooker's,et.al.,so....

IkoXyeNTHqpU24dHKmIcrw.review_text: "When the only sound in the empty street, Is the heavy tread of the heavy feet That belong to a lonesome cop I open shop. When the moon so long has been gazing down On the wayward ways of this wayward town. That her smile becomes a smirk, I go to work." - Billie Holiday, Love for Sale  I'm waiting to fall in love with a Jazz club in San Francisco.  Everyone always says Yoshi's is the place to go and while I've been there more than a few times, the kind of music I'm looking for isn't fairly represented at any of the jazz venues in the Bay Area.  Every city has a place where headliners frequent (IE - Yoshi's, Boom Boom Room, The Warfield, The Independent, etc)... but it's hard to find a place where the local talent can really shine through.  The Boom Boom Room has a lot of acclaim in San Francisco, and while the talent has always been mediocre, none of it has ever been amazing the multiple times I've been there.  I can review the rest of the bar, but honestly, the only thing that matters about a jazz club is the jazz.  And outside of the headliners, this place has mediocre talent.  Now, outside of it being a mediocre jazz club, the bar is good.  The bartenders are excellent, there's a lot of space to walk around in, and the clientele is friendly.  My suggestion, go with a group of friends.  While it's definitely easy to meet people there, I've always had a lot more fun when I've gone with a group of people I know.

58ZGUbmRpf8_lEHdE47upQ.review_text: I went this past Valentine's Day to see Eric McFadden rock out and can honestly tell you THIS is what San Fran is about for me.  A collection of different kinds of people-- the hipster, neo hippie, bohemian, grunge rocker,etc --more than likely all locals-- blues music, rock music, flowing moderately priced drinks, and the smell of sweetness in the air.  First time I was there and I didn't want to leave! I just hope I can have myself the same experience when I get to go again.  Go if you get the chance, or if you are looking for a fabulous hang out hole in the wall.

K9UCL5zroxiczuS4iZTSNw.review_text: NVO, the best band in the history of my relationship with the boom boom room, is the reason this venue is so great. THey rock my socks off once a month.   Drinks are overpriced, but the space is great.

f2_ORdto2MUlxp6-LlmKgg.review_text: Major props to The Boom Boom room for being a great host venue for tired Fillmore Jazz Festival partiers!  I visited this place for the first time last Saturday as we were traveling up and down Fillmore street for the jazz festival (which was so amazing this year!). We had been up and down the street a couple times already at this point and we were looking for a place to kinda rest while still soaking up some good music...that and I figured this would be a perfectly valid reason to visit the venue since I've always wanted to visit it.  Saturday, BBR was free and hosting a live band (forgot the name) and some great drink specials, to which the bouncer encouraged you to get them "to-go". I got into some $5 sangria and sweet tea vodka concoctions. Both drinks would have been great, had they not been watered down with club soda. Considering this was part of a pretty big event, I'm sure they were just taking precaution to not get everyone wasted, for that I respect them.  The venue has a very historic and iconic feel to it. It's very old-school, pretty spacious. The bar staff was kinda...off. They were either tired, stressed or a high mix of the two.  I'm definitely interested in checking out this place on a weekend night to see how a "normal" weekend looks here.

65uUyG9yuF0rdMh0z7ajaA.review_text: Great bands on all the good nights (and even relatively often on the off-nights), and nothing but live music all the time.  Sound system is usually too loud, but well balanced, unlike a lot of other venues where it's clear their sound guy has gone deaf. Beer is definately the best deal - the hard stuff is expensive and comes in small glasses.  They only take cash! Oh, and the shows almost always start an hour late.  Just FYI.

KyWWK9Rhb_2Lkq0BeBIE1A.review_text: I love dark, intimate bars with great live music, so naturally, I love The Boom Boom Room. Unfortunately, the older I get, the less tolerance I have for insanely crowded, hot places....I've become a bit of a claustrophobe.   Still, this place is an SF landmark that stands the test of time. I've had some great booty-shakin' nights there! Arrive early to get a table by the door. The fresh air will do you justice.

-zuV9Du1HFHaQ6GnVyGWsQ.review_text: I am not sure why people are such fans of this place.  Yes, the place does serve up some good music, but the other flaws don't make up for it.   First, I hate cover charges.  The $15 cover charge for a no-name band late at night was not worth it.   The bar is a dive and although I love dives, I was not impressed with this one.  It feels dirty.  The bathrooms are shoved in the back with the cleaning supplies and one of the stalls did not have a lock.

9rV7510hkaNeQrkRMbFvTg.review_text: I came here for the first time during the #JazZFestival. Incredible line-up, great crowd. Awesome party for someone who puts events together! Yup! Can't wait To go back again!!!

EBCx-v9I16v6fJnrQ_ze1Q.review_text:
Saw Colossus last night (tuesday) and was my first time there.
 Sound was good but the mics sucked...couldnt hear a word.
  Very nice place....nice lighting, good size, friendly bartenders, and most importantly, good music.  I will definately be back for more live acts!

7db6kIADaDWSnQ9lCNRitg.review_text: If you can handle the cover ($10-$20) check this place out when "Brown Baggin' It" are performing. People here like to get down.

iHwqxEYgwk6G3aMwGsaQGQ.review_text: Always wanted to go here and finally made it!  Went on a Sunday night and danced my face off. The place was pretty empty but the live blues music was fantastic and the drinks were strong. No cover! Great large old school place for seeing a show. I'll definitely be checking the schedule and going back soon!

3R9-ipOHa5Xm6Z8TrlWHRw.review_text: Place is shady. After every act, the recollect a cover charge. Better not step outside for a phone call or cigarette because they'll recharge you even if you have a stamp. BEWARE!

dtpkN_WphCWeTThQYYraAQ.review_text: Don't be fooled by my roomate jason's previous posting, this place deserves 5 stars. Whether you're into a laid back jazz session or some good old funky norleans style tunes, you'll be happy here. They often don't charge cover on off nights even though you will still see some goods acts then. get there early if you want a seat, otherwise you'll be spending the night a dancin' yo feet.

UiX4CR188mjByb8GeI8jYQ.review_text: I'm not really big on the Jazz & Blues but this is a cool little place in Japan town to grab a reasonably priced drink.  The crowd and bar staff here are pretty cool.   It's a bit on the dive bar side of things relative to other places nearby so if you're the uppity sort you shouldn't even consider this place.

wOg03_bLMKnDiWvPGeLovA.review_text: I had the worst experience with the bouncer I have ever had.  I showed up at the end of the night and asked for a discount.  The bouncer said no(he was a blonde guy with stupid big glasses like a dumb hipster).  I smoked a cigarrete with friends and decided I would pay since all my friends were in there even thought the show was almost over.  When I approached him to pay, the bouncer proceeded to tell me that I was a horrible person and to "fuck off".  This is the worst experience I have ever had in San Francisco.  The other guys attending the door had no power and shrugged off his actions.  I'm curious if this was the owner or a tight friend of the owner and they just have no respect for people who frequent their venue.  For anyone looking for a fun time in San Francisco, beware of this horrible place.  They will make you feel terrible and ruin your night.

ACUVZ4SiN0gni7dzVDm9EQ.review_text: I used to always bemoan the at least $15 cover charge when walking by the Boom Boom Room. Until my mind was blown by the most epic accidental show I've seen. When a band you've never heard of takes the stage and the three members are wearing the following items you are in for a good night:  Lead singer - shirtless with a Robinhood-esque hat that had lightening blots shooting out of it. He played a cello that was strung like a guitar. Bassist - toga. That's all. Drummer - 80s rock attire, hair band style.  It was a rollicking good time.   Pair that with the sweet dim lights, decently priced cocktails, and ample room to sit at the bar or boogie on the floor and you can color me happy.

km2eR66jxH38sp3esKowGQ.review_text: We were there on a sunday evening after I had read about this place on the internet before. It was a great experience with a super atmosphere, great people and great music. This place is a small room with seating around the edge. At the beginning DJ Kevvy Kev played a smooth mix and then the Gemstone Band started a great performance including drums, guitar, bass and keys. Several MC's came on stage and most of them dropped amazing performances. The drinks were good and not expensive. After a short while, most people came in front of the stage following the live performances of the artists. I definitely want to come back to Boom Boom Room, when I will be in SF for the next time.

R-i4F_rOYAMipGlvlP7A-Q.review_text: I actually went here a couple of weeks ago to watch the Greasetraps play - it's a nice, intimate venue for live music, diverse crowd, and judging by how wildly a lot of people around me were dancing, I'm gonna guess the drinks were nice and strong that particular night, too ;)  I'd love to come here again post-baby and get tanked while doing really bad drunken dancing with the usual folks.

XP32BMm5JmcogLMTf-JUGg.review_text: Good music. Cover was $20 though so a bit pricey. I didn't pay for drink so I can't tell you if it was worth paying cover. The lighting is soo dim I started getting sleepy there. I need to go on a non-exhausting day.

UZ6YOaTiZ1lTZWKASIkVuA.review_text: This intimate club is just the place to bring your out of town guests for some great live music on a chilly and wet Sunday night. Here's why:  - Ambiance= dimly lit, cozy and a billowing red curtain onstage  - Pretension= totally lacking - Crowd= mixed and interesting - Staff= friendly and laid-back - Boom factor= awesome (especially if you're there for the Pimps of Joytime)  Plus you won't hear lyrics like "I lick ya boom boom down" or "boom boom mami mami" even if that's what you think of whenever you hear the name Boom Boom Room. Oh, is that just me?  Minus one star for not accepting credit cards.

SERp7ZPIpmSrs9F3foQuPw.review_text: Always great music and vibe. If you're into funk and soul music, this is your place. Great hang with awesome music bookings and affordable drinks.   Two suggestions:  1) keep track of your valuables (bit of crime in area- esp car break ins). 2) come for the music but stay for the people and scene -- I've made so many new friends there.

ml3vS1NZTMeXTuxamvAZgw.review_text: This is a solid joint. They always have some interesting music acts coming through, so its just a matter of finding the group that hits your spot best. The last time I was here a good buddy from Chi-town was in.  He and I used to frequent the Green Mill, which is every bit as legendary. For Green Mill info see: yelp.com/biz/t3pYu8eidmb… I find that the Boom Boom Room works best for me when I'm with people that can appreciate the sound or if I'm looking for a more intimate evening without all the loud chaos of a typical bar. Boom Boom has a definite urban/swank city feel to it.  Its a small joint, but a quality option for the more sophisticated city aficionado.

C5Pf0I0YZEEw2cG8yTcH4Q.review_text: Great spot - great crowd - great line-up and the staff seem to manage getting your drink orders to you in record time despite the crush.

m4LS4mkSIX9LTaMPst4UBg.review_text: No, not the boom, boom, let's go back to my room kind of bar.  It is just one great small intimate bar with some great live music that you can dance to. And the price of the drinks are not that bad. Plus it is close to Japantown, so more likely this place is going to be one of those bars I would go back to. Parking can be a little tricky though since you have to park on the street, and as everyone knows parking in San Francisco is like finding a needle in the haystack or could cost you an arm and a leg, but if you are willing to be patient and wait for someone to leave their parking space (if ever, early on a weekend), then it is worth it.

JW6IZYE9_IswFT3booJA5A.review_text: Great place for Jazz/Blues - 5th star is missing due to seating (or lack of).

io7NI06ByR7JthVlS29YPA.review_text: Why the Boom Boom room rocks.  First off i am forced to venture to many straight bars since i am the token gay in my circle of friends. Years of going to the marina and broadway have made me jaded toward the straght trendy club scene. So when we came here it was all good.  Its close to the filmore and a great place to put down some drinks before a live show. Its cheaper to drink here than at the filmore, which is only a block away. I've only been here twice. Each time I've stayed for a little under 2 hours and had a blast. The crowd seemed pretty laid back and not up tight. Another bonus is that one of my best friends lives about two blocks away.  This is a fun place to hang out with your friends and chat it up while listening to a variety of often live music.

WKu8N3wK9k1sRfXCA3SZ8Q.review_text: Great interior, nice staff, some fabulous funky bands, and a good sound system. The cover charge seems to have gone up recently, but still not bad value. One of the high spots of Fillmore St.

oCjsMCIGd2VJJk0BzgipCw.review_text: The music here is consistently good. I saw Kirk Joseph & Backyard Groove last night. Rockin'.  I love me some sousaphone. The sousaphone was named for its inventor, John Philip Sousa, who adapted the helicon to project warm rich tones over the top of the band.  Kudos to JPS, as those warm rich tones did carry and forthwith imbued me with 'the funk'.  Here are some anagrams of 'sousaphone':  A no-use shop. Push a noose. Anuses pooh.

4v9NX1EzLUH7inkmgHwUxA.review_text: Okay, so I was only here once and that one time only entailed 2 cans of PBR, a discussion comparing the set-up of the Lusty Lady to Foucault's theorization of the panopticon, and a healthy game of "avoid the loser dudes trying to make eye contact" with us. "Us" being Amanda and I and "loser dudes" being, well, every other fucking patron there. From reading the other yelp reviews of this place, I can see that it generally receives positive responses, so again, lemme reiterate that I was only here once and for maybe 30 minutes, tops. Why was I even at, um, the Boom Boom Room? Simply because Julie had our tickets for a show at the Fillmore and, in pure Julie-style, sent a last minute text asserting her 1/2 hour delay. Of course that night was, like, 40 degrees and windy as fuck, so Amanda and I were left with no other recourse besides spending some time in the Boom Boom Room. With that said, we brought some serious fortune with us and only caught the end of that evening's band's sound check, and holy christ, it appeared as though they all met at the cooler in the IT department of whatever horrible job y'all work and decided to form a really fresh jazz-rock band. Fronted by NERDS!!!!! Yeah, as though jazz-rock bands are fronted by anyone else. Anyway, said band also brought their fellow nerdy IT cohorts and a few chachbags to boot (no pun intended), so Amanda and I were definitely given numerous "hook up" opportunities.   However, the Boom Boom Room did manage to keep us warm and serve us cans of PBR.  Plus, when Enrico and Julie FINALLY showed up, Enrico bought us shots of Jameson, making the IT nerds begin to look pret-ty fetching.

i67PU7LKRSS7oZM4WQAmQg.review_text: This is a small dive bar with good music, drinks, and a nice crowd of people.  With a good buzz you'd forget about how smail the place is.  I've been to the Boom Boom Room 3 times and I may have been lucky to see some very good live performers.  What I really like about the place is it brings in good people who love music and look to have a nice time.

rs9EzfqI_yWqULOlW7rZpg.review_text: I love this bar and have been going sporadically since it opened. However my last experience there was ruined by the doormen who were completely unfriendly and came searching for me to charge me the $12 cover that began at 9 or so.  I'd already been there 2 hours spending money and not planning to leave anytime soon.  One guy barely let me in to retrieve my stuff and tell my friends.  I don't know about a place that charges after someone's already been there a while.  Most clubs have a free before a certain hour, no?  He was such an ass to me that I have little interest in returning, though I generally love the place and probably will.

ZbOK_2m4kifew3lzTep1yQ.review_text: Despite the fact that its name implies you'd be getting some action, the only action I got here was the crazy ingestion of booze to withstand the beatings from the mosh pit at the Ministry concert.  It was relatively quiet here, nice way to start the evening--you grab a few beers, sit down and start talking. About ANYTHING. After a few bottles no one is really going to remember anyways, right?   The space was small, but had a hip feel to it. Definitely a space I could get my groupie on in if I was the type of person to put out...and if there was a band.  Do bands play here? Or am I out of my fucking mind??  Because I distinctly remember a band being here.  ...  /end review until I go back and prove it.  Oh yeah but the bathrooms were a little gnarley. How I remember THAT is beyond me.

I8M4bz0BLS97_UVcRjGNlQ.review_text: Visiting from Boston. Looked up live music and landed here, great bands and fantastic atmosphere. Good luck to the venue and talented artists that come through those doors! I will be back...

P5bUL3Engv-2z6kKohB6qQ.review_text: For a long while I had no idea that John Lee Hooker lived not too far from me when he died. Little did know back then that he also owned the Boom Boom Room. Many years have passed and I've only gone recently. I've been watching a band called Vinyl out of Mill Valley that crank out out some awesome Funk/Latin/Reggae/Blues for a long while now. I knew they played here every once in a while and finally decided to take a stab at seeing them.   The place is way smaller than I imagined. It is essentially a bar that happens to have a stage at the end. The crowd is crazy weird. Marina types, Burning Man types, hipsters, preppies, and old folks. It's all over the map. When the band came on it was standing room only and it was getting to be a pain to actually try and see the band. Luckily one of the booths opened up and when we sat at the angle we did, we could kind of see them. They played well on till 2.45am and it was kind of cool to see them in such a small space. Just a bit claustro if you know what I mean. Anways, the staff seem to work hard and if you can get past the sardine like packed crazy crowd it's not a bad place to see a band. 3.5 stars.

m9vkagc4KEn5X47J9WGOBw.review_text:
So this place is mostly cool but not all-the-way live like it should be.  It is the "meeting your friend of the opposite sex's good friend" of music venues.  You're glad you met the good friend and yet you know you can never really make out with them.  I mean, you can (and, let's be real - you're gonna) but it will be an "issue" that no one will really talk about until, like, one night when you drunkenly step on OSF's foot and they yell, "fucking whore" at you.  Well, it's more the beginning of the story feeling (OSGF is great- just like OSF - only hot and potentially ravagable!) rather than the downhill "effing w" statement.  Is any of this resonating?  
  To recap:
 Good venue sound-wise
 Pretty tight, professional-level bands
 Sometimes pretty dorky-in-the-unsexy-way clientele
 Steep cover
 Uncharmable door guys
 Stiff, reasonably priced drinks
 90% humidity

D0y6NhDuSaOSZBLoEOJxag.review_text: Why did it take me all my life to finally come here? Such a cozy fun venue to listen to some amazing music. JNG on Sunday night rocked my boat , socks and whole lot of other body parts that I'll leave to your imagination. Surprisingly romantic place to cuddle up to your honey if you so pleased.

E-Sgmcl3VfDAVG-04e5ldw.review_text: Immediately the name makes you think of the movie LIFE with Martin Lawrence & Eddie Murphy were Eddie talks about a club he wants to own in NY called Rays Boom Boom Room but I digress.  So came here this past Fri nite after catching Aisha Tyler at a comedy club. I'm from LA so I was trying to use the entire night to the fullest.   When I arrived it was only an hour left before the club closed (still charged $10). They were giving me shyt about my I.D. because I lost mine and I had that big azz 5x7 paper the dmv gives you till it arrives in the mail. They were acting like they were doing me a favor by letting me in. IT'S FROM THE DMV SMART DUMMIES!  So after the shenanigans once I got thru the door I felt like it was my welcome song to the Bay area because they had a DOPE azz band there named Los Hentes & they were performing "I got 5 on it" . That band is SUPER talented they went from rap to reggae to latin music. So if this band is performing here... GO!

z8zzFMKCnavBY5_-_vzi9w.review_text: i'm gonna be short on this one b/c there really ain't a lot to say to back up my five.  Alex the owner and primary booker of music over the years is a wonderful guy and an asset to the community in music booking he has brought in New Orleans folks like Morning 40 Federation, Papa Grows Funk, first ever SF Porter Batiste Stoltz shows and on and on.  Super cool interior (wow I love the overhead lighting in this place, truly cool lounge lighting), reasonable drink prices, crowded at times (go hang in the far corner in front of the old John Lee Hooker round vip booth or over by the entrance to onstage near the Hammond, you can usually do better than in front of the stage) ...right across from The Fillmore so terrific for post or pre show hang.   Often has ability to stay open past 2 w/ no drinks so a cool joint for after 2 am getting yer groove on (and often special guests from that night's Fillmore groovedowns).   anyway, I guess that is it.   Alex, thanks for all of the good times over the last X number of years!  Servers bartenders and door folk are always very cool from my experience.

kK996Gx3ZoR7Avd5WILFEg.review_text: Many years ago, this used to be a dive called Jacks Bar. Then John Lee Hooker retired and bought it and turned it into his dream bar. JLH has since passed on, but walking into the boom boom room is sort of like stepping into his world.  Think red leather and vinyl, dark colored lights, antique fixtures. It's a good place to watch a band; intimate but still big enough for a decent sized crowd, and the bartenders are friendly (Hi Dana! Thanks for taking care of my sister on her big night!)  They have decent happy hours specials, and I was checking out the barstools and I think with some time and effort I could break one in enough that it would fit my ass perfectly and I could sit there every afternoon until I'm seventy and almost blind and wearing a suit and hat every day and telling wistful semi coherent stories about my youth to anyone who will listen. That's what God wants for me, I think.

QYUdOyXau5rfGFdyGF5f0g.review_text: yes!!!! a place that actually plays good local blues and jazz! the cover is always decent, the drinks are whatevs, but its all about the jams here. monophonics are the bombdizzle and just about any other band they put on their lineup. i couldn't dare step foot in those clubs with all that pop mess playing .....give me live music! this place got it goin' on! and what a location! there is a variety of restaurants to choose from to go before you catch a show and after. enjoy!

nsawcqioX0NDmqsDsM8L4w.review_text: Very intimate venue for music.  The music was great the crowd was mixed for a Wednesday before Thanksgiving day.  The bouncers were nice, but one of the bartenders.. yeah not so much.  I order a drink and it didn't taste good and she made me buy another one resulting in 3 stars.  BAM!  I'd go again.  Japan town is right next door and worth a visit.

J7ka23aCUNK-v_yLB4AL1Q.review_text: Nothing beats grabbing some drinks at the Boom Boom Room before a show at the Fillmore. Dark, velvety, bass-y music, perfect. Get comfy and slam back a few cocktails while grooving to some good music. Cash only.

KKdBQXnUlVUZ0ZNTfMQoEA.review_text: The Boom Boom Room is really chill place for cool cats...I think. I went here by myself on a Saturday night. yeehaw. So you can imagine, I was looking for a little inspiration out there in the "I'm not in pac heights but I feel I am but  I'm in Japantown because I am" part of San Francisco. The Boom Boom Room's stiff cover ($15) was not a good start.  But once inside, everything got a lot better. The music, both acts were some sort of latin-infused, semi-reggae, indie rock ensembles. One of the bands had an unbelievably cute girl playing saxophone. In any case, the bartenders smiled and didnt have the typical "I'm way too stressed out for this job" frown on their faces. The drinks were reasonably prices and they had a decent selection of solid beers. The people, though a bit older (something like 26-40 yrs old), were actually pretty awesome. It's hard to run across a place with such a high cover where the people are actually worth a crap and this seems (at first visit) to be on those places.  So, Boom Boom Room, I will be back. I like your vibe, your intimate settins, and your people. So drop the cover 5 bucks and continue being kinda awesome.

AT6NwNkLKxgW2fsQGNs-gA.review_text: Yeah, it's a narrow venue that can feel a bit claustrophobic, but that long-ass bar increases your chances to get some attention from one of the 'tenders. If you're discouraged by the steep cover or not into the group playing on a particular night, it's still a cool place to go for happy hour or early in the evening before you go elsewhere.

02RFzdPmsH2dnl7Gdo8aLg.review_text: You like funk? You like jazzy funk? You like live jazzy funk? You like good live jazzy funk? You like a dance floor for jazzy funk dancing? You like dim lights and jazzy funk? You like alcohol and jazzy funk? What are you waiting for?   Go to the famous BOOM BOOM ROOM. Definitely a poppin' spot for the grown and sexy. boomboomblues.com

GaDcMPw8aH-pvsKfltH4pw.review_text: In my more than 20 years performing in some rank dive bars and hole in the wall joints where you're often worried that your car will be on fire when you finally pack up and leave, I'm happy to report that the Boom Boom Room is a great place to play. The sound system is good, complete with a Hammond and authentic Leslie speaker on stage! The engineer was super nice and responsive - the house sound was spot on!  As much fun as we had playing, the audience was having an even better time. A nice dance floor, quick bar staff, friendly door staff!   This is now my favorite place to see small live shows and I hope to play there again soon!  -Aaron of West Grand Blvd.

9NrrS89GYV4F1D8JnY_SDA.review_text: Cool little bar across the street from the fillmore. It's dark, it's smokey and the musical acts I've seen here have been, well, dark and smokey. A cool place to chill out with a nice and easy vibe. Funk, jazz, blues, hip hop.

pRDdcScJUj6lA60rFUH1VA.review_text: The mothership landed yesterday evening at the Boom Boom Room when Katdelic completely rocked the place and it was awesome.  The venue itself is intimate, not that expensive, the crowd chill and the bartenders super nice. A bit rough and divey on the edges but that's the way such a place should be. Suggestion for the owners: DO A FUNK JAM SESSION! I will definitely go there again very soon.

YII6qimAQ9RD_NByf80ZYw.review_text: Ah...I liked this place!  As a new comer to SF in search of free live music.  I ended up at the Boom Boom Room late in the evening last Thursday.  Low lights and candles in red holders flickered away on tables as we saw an excellent band, The George Lacson Project, for free.  I had never heard of them before that night, and they proved to be extremely entertaining...and they were getting ready to play another set when we left after midnight!  I love that other Yelp reviewers found their new favorite band at this place too!  A small but friendly crowd danced and mingled.  For more info about my experience at this place and about other free live music options, check out my article, "Free (or super cheap) Live Music Every Night of the Week in San Francisco at questforzest.org/wp/zest….  Happy live music hunting!

RZUGrWB5EiNwaXHi6ZH7fw.review_text: Always been a fan of the boom boom room, always been a fan of saying boom boom! Lights are always low, good music is always playing even if it's just the jukebox going and it's the perfect place to end up after catching a show at the Fillmore.   Last night was kind of a bummer, there was supposed to be a live band but they didn't end up showing and there were a few weird guys looming inside and out that 9 times out of 10 would have been asked to leave. Especially the guy wearing a sweatshirt 18 sizes too big asking everyone what their name was, and I think he only had one drink?   Otherwise, it's a great bar in an otherwise barless few block location.

l-1g7hDc1bS1xjtyxY79hw.review_text: I met a friend here fairly early in the night, in time for their awesome Happy Hour and before the cover vultures started to descend. The Happy Hour is fantastic... I think it goes for three hours, they charge the same low price for all their drafts (except the frat boy beer which is even cheaper), which includes two offerings from Rogue Ales, and a good selection of domestic micros and European imports across the board. The bartender was fun... she had a huge neon fro wig on, and was slinging drinks like a boss.  Definitely a good vibe in the place. The music is fresh... it's a 70's booty-shaking soulfest.  If you haven't heard James Brown since you came in, you're either still on your first beer or waiting for it.  They do live music later in the nights, but that comes with a cover.  The band we saw warming up was meh, but I declined the request to pay the cover and bounced before they got into full swing.  If I had planned to be there for the duration I'm sure I would have seen some folks hit the dance floor.  Funky fresh... thumbs up!

d1VXeXMq67_QgdvWY1tcKQ.review_text: Some people prefer to thing of the boom boom room as a bar that has live music that charges expensive covers.  I prefer to think of it as an intimate music venue with a bar that has really cheap tickets for their shows.  They really have an uncanny way of almost always booking great talent, some local, some national, and quite often, the opening band is even better than the headliner.  There aren't many music clubs in the city where I'll just go drop money on some band I've never heard of and know that it will be money well-spent.  Sure, the shows always start late, but they go until 2 or 3 in the morning. Solid beer selection, too.  Also, being across the street from the Fillmore, you never know just who might drop by after playing a show at the Fillmore.   Not the greatest area to walk around, but I don't think that should have any effect on my review.  And don't go in the booth at the front of the stage.  update: everything in my previous review still stands, but wanted to point out that this might be the only regular afterhours live music place in SF. when most places shutdown at 2, there's still quite a lot of clubs you can go to (ruby skye, endup, 1015, mighty, public works, dna, etc.), but this is the only live music venue

79u3Z2ySFFWOBK0x3H348w.review_text: I've been here a few times. I don't even look to see whose playing there anymore, I just go--I've never been disappointed. Outstanding funk & blues. Cover charge is worth every penny. Go later in the evening (~10:30pm) and go for the music. Not a good place to go to catch up with your out-of-town buddy over a few beers, go too early and the place is uncomfortably chill.

gA_WtyzkuZp55dDbQLg-Ww.review_text: oh yeah - and i forgot to mention that they got my bank information under the pretense that it was necessary to replace the money in my account (yes i know i'm a moron) and so i've had to cancel my card and get a new one.    i just really can't think of anything bad enough to say about these assholes.

1zMqzFE_X1Bf29Lp2RXF2Q.review_text: Why is it that MOST of the bad reviews for the Boom Boom Room are coming from young, college aged girls that haven't even experienced life yet. Stay home if you don't like the bathrooms. It's a club not the Ritz!

hFuYtKcJKVLXLURJLx6DoQ.review_text: Went to see the Trombone Shorties from New Orleans and they are so energitic and fun!!! I loved them not just because they are all of 21 years old and talented and cute.....but because they are real down to earth people and not pretencious rock stars.   We invited them to come over for Jambalaya and drinks and music and they announced to the entire crowd at the end of the 2nd set that the official after party was at 3014 Steiner (my friends apartment)!  WHAT!?!?!  Thats right !! Random people, boom boom door men etc.. all showed up and we had a blast with the Trombone Shorties, singing, drinking wine and singing...till the weee hours of the morning!   It was a surreal nite! Making friends with a band members that toured with Lenny Gravitz for two years.  Now, we have special invitations to Jazz Fest!   Boom Boom Room - made a BIG BANG in my musical heart!   You guys ROCK!

25X-uRdgoLe0K5ArrnNrhg.review_text: BOOM BOOM BOOM is a pretty chill lounge with no cover, I went a few times during happy hours.  The place wasn't overly crowded when I went.  It is located conveniently off the corner of FIlmore/Geary.  The first time I went there I almost missed it because it doesn't really stand out when you first walk by it.

0aZBtOfadnwk146wcH-cmw.review_text: all i could think about was Eddie Murphy in LIFE.  Opening up the Boom Boom Room and the waiters, and gambling, and live music.  There are no waiters no gambling but there is Plenty of awesome live music.   Most definitely a great place to listen to some good Funk/jazz!    Be sure to get your tickets in advace so you can waltz right in!

CPdkpOswYgtdxMPUbZ0T9Q.review_text: Only went for a random, mid-afternoon Happy Hour drink on this past Saturday, and wound up hunkered own there shooting the breeze with some patrons and my date, as well as the bartendress, Sasha. The drinks were strong and cheap, the vibe was...well...kinda dead, but at 3 or 4 on a Saturday, that's ok, and I kind of like my bars semi empty for ease of grabbing boozey bevvies anyway. I'd love to go back and hear some live music though just to see what the venue is like in that mode. If in the Fillmore/J-Town area on a weekend afternoon - I highly suggest checking it out. The happy hour was pretty long too if memory serves me correctly...

FbhKqAAHQBnl_pVKTVPuHA.review_text: I love going to shows at the Fillmore- so I end up coming here for post-fillmore to end the night.  It's usually a lot of fun, but its not that great of a venue. Ends up being really expensive to go there with the $15 cover charge that I pay every-single-time-i-go-there.  It's pretty nice inside and pleasant when there is a low-key show. The staff inside has always been pretty quick with the drinks and as friendly as you can be when it's slammed and everyone is wasted.  The guys at the door are dressed in suits, and the dozen or so times I've been here they've always been douche bags with a serious attitude. Since I don't want to get kicked out I haven't told them that yet.

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: 01.26.10  I'm torn.    I like the layout of the place.   I like live music. I don't like cover charges.  Especially on a Tuesday night. I don't like expensive beer.  I'm torn.

UDFCWnHOvkENxbKGlEsLyg.review_text: so i'm on crutches.  for a long time.  and it sucks.  if i had my way, i would sit at home all day and night and not go out.  but the old man wouldn't hear of it.  so we go out.  all the time.  and on crutches...it sucks.  we were planning to go see will bernard and friends and celebrate a homegirls birthday at the boom boom room.  i made the plan that if i couldn't get a seat, i would leave.  cause there is no way i can stand through a show, (especially at the boom boom room where they let them play all night) on crutches.  we got there early but all the seats were taken.  an employee came right up to me and said follow me and brought me to the reserved booth- reserved for john lee hooker (and alex- the owner).  after hanging for awhile, alex came over to see who i was and after hearing the medical sob story behind my crutches, let me sit with him and his friends.  he was awesome.  he made me feel so welcome and helped me forget about my woes for a night.    i have been to the boom boom room a few times now- always to see will bernard- and it has always been a great experience.  they don't have the cheapest or strongest drinks- but the bud light is cold and the bartenders are friendly.    i never met john lee hooker- but after a night of sitting in his seat i feel a close connection to him.  and to alex, the owner...my new friend!

RdtD_EaJolktp6qgHjx24g.review_text: This place is cool, wasn't very happenin this Thursday night, but the music was good. We heard public property, which had quite a sublime vibe and since i'm from So. Cal I loved it.  Wasn't much of  a crowd though.  I was not drinking either, so I don't have any comments on the beverage menu....I'll try to be comprehensive next time, would definitely go back if I want to go back and have NOTHING else to do, laid back atmosphere.

uj3KfOQgFPHZM_C7vdgMNQ.review_text: This place always has jamming music and some ecletic  funk acts. Nice chicago-style blues club feel which is hard to find in the city. It's definitely a classic stop that is a must in this city. Another bonerific perk was the hot cocktail waitress with the piercings. I went back in December and can't really remember the show because I kept watching her handle the room with a sweet smile, even the gross skeezy older drunk dudes. I haven't seen her lately but she was totally smoking with her exotic appeal and funky fresh clothes, Rockin those Docs! No drink specials which was kinda disappointing, but I came from Alembic which has rockin bourbon drinks. But its a legendary spot that all John Lee Hooker fans shud see

rDTr5r0xEMpQpkPphe66KQ.review_text: John Lee Hooker.  Boom Boom Boom Boom.  Mean licks.

Ct456aEICzDfn03MHZCzsw.review_text: Miri D. got it pretty close. Some nights (Fri/Sat) filled with either too many penninsulan programming geeks thinkin this is the place to act pseudo cool and do a hook up, whilst one of their buddy stares at my breasts for 30 minutes straight. What a weird vibe. Some nights totally fun. Door nuts (or do they think they "bounce")  think they are serious with the pseudo zoot dragging coat hiding their beer belly and covering their comb over wid da Fedora----well maybe just balding pate.  Ohhhh what we put up with for good music....

SO7LPNjOUus6ML0AJCuVMA.review_text: You pay $8+ for a drink and it is watered down.  I have been there many time and each time it is the same.  It is on me to keep buying drinks I know are watered down and let this place keep ripping me off this way,  I should have stopped going there a long time ago or at least switched to beer which would foil their blatant practice.   I am no longer, at this time, into the narrow focus of bands they book so I no longer need to tolerate the indignity of buying bogus drinks.

gJNvlVyYNnyQW-941nu7sA.review_text: Bad vibes right from the door staff that greets you like you stole something. Got there for a show that was suppossed to start at 9:45 and didn't until after 1100. Watered done overpriced cocktails and a surly bartending staff that acted like they were doing you a big favor. Haven't been here in a couple of years, it sure isn't the same as when the "ole' man" was alive==bar stools all ripped up,chairs stacked up in one of the ladies (2) cubicles and filthy to boot. The Marina Brats who have invaded this once cool space may think they are hip to be slummin' but this place is just downright nasty now. The entertainment which never disappointed in the past sucked so bad I couldn't stay for the FIRST set--Victor Jones and Cuturevirsity are way past their expiration date

dim5Svrt-B1jvvQsOIX22A.review_text: Another 5 star experience on Fillmore Street.    The people here will probably remember me as the crazy white girl who was running around asking everyone if they were going to the Willie Nelson concert.  The idiots at the Chronicle advertised that his first performance was April 12th, and I spent an hour taking shots here and running back  to the Fillmore entrance to see if a show was taking place.  Turns out the show didn't take place until the 16th.  However the server was very nice and patient with me.  Our concert gang came here after the Willie show, and they had a hot band playing with good energy.  Too bad I was here on a Sunday night as I already entered the Badlands of Bad Hangover and couldn't party as much as I wanted to.  And I like any room with a red padded door so I'll definitely be back.

c9YEPEZZ5r0g9PrQr17GBg.review_text: Have been meaning to write a review since we were there a few months ago. What a great little place for music. Friendly and intimate. A nice dance floor. Good drink pricing (even on the weekend). We had a blast. Danced until they closed.   4 stars as it's a bit in need of some remodeling.   Parking not bad- street mostly. Neighborhood is a little sketchy at 2 AM but fine for city types.

KB6gQqzPVtHBcD40wf09pg.review_text: Boom Boom Rooooom!!   Just saying Boom Boom Room makes me feel happy. It's a cool venue, small so you don't feel like you're lost among the crowd, but big enough that you don't have to stand with a group you're trying to avoid. Drinks are standard with standard prices, the bouncer and bartenders are nice.  I went a couple years back with a guy I was crushing on, and sadly made a fool of myself by making out on the dance floor. I mean, who cares, right? It's only now, seeing other youngsters do the same thing that makes me look back on those days and shake my head in disbelief that I could be so silly.   I went to a show for my friend's band Solwave on Thursday and it was super fun. Hibbity Dibbity also played and they were cool too. I accidentally left my debit card there and my friends told me to just forget about it, as I guess some places charge a fee when you leave your card (?? is that a thing?) but when I went to pick it up on Saturday the bartender was super nice and sifted through the mass amount of other forgotten cards, happily handed it to me, and informed it was closed out, with a wink and a smile.   I'm sure I'll be back soon, when there's a cool band playing, duh, and hopefully won't leave my card again.

c2TEIJAFBGrK9okSn2HXBQ.review_text: This place earns a 5 star! I went here on Tuesday night. No entry fee and I got to listen to a band called Modern day Moonshine! My new favorite band! Ambiance was not over the top and the ceiling had some interesting design.. Drinks, reasonable prices and stiff! My date had gin and tonic and I enjoyed a glass of wine. I am a big fan of fancy bathrooms, even though the bathroom was not too fancy, it was definitely worth the sexy bathroom shot! This place gets a 5 star for being inexpensive and having great live entertainment! Also, it was a mixed crowd, people of all ages. I would feel at home coming to this place with sweats or heals, never in combination! LOL Going back soon!

QOlY5FYliVVvkgqgtjdP_w.review_text: If you're looking for a place to chill around Japantown, you cannot do better than this bar.  Great vibe.  Great live music.  It's the real deal.

edmfYmN3FBuJjc7ERYYgTA.review_text: Greatest blues bar in the city, hands down. Go here.

7CJBasUIoN6Ioo99dl_kqA.review_text: $20 to get in to see no name band  I felt sick after 1 beer they must not clean the beer pipes small venue,people seem to push you when going to bathroom  even if you left a large gap,  the ale was pretty bitter and no flavor  when its free in I would go back and drink bottled beer

ySnJRrXNpbHuGYsm5mEAVA.review_text: Well......  Horrible service. The bartender treated me like an idiot and rolled her eyes at me for ordering a Guinness. My bad! I'm SO sorry to waste your time lady.   Besides that the venue was pretty large. We arrived early for a happy hour cocktail and a band was just setting up. We couldn't hear each other if we tried, so my friend and I screamed at each other for about an hour then left. Good times.

nFW2ne4eYhh3PqUM7fxLOQ.review_text: Located btw Fillmore and Geary the Boom Boom Room has not disappointed me yet.  Live music Good drinks Decent crowd  All of these  3 things are good and make me happy when I come here.

isFwuvisyu1iCLm3J2wSpg.review_text: john lee hooker is dead ok!!!??!! he's never going to come sit at his fucking table so just take down the stupid sign, quit kicking me and my friends out and open up that beautiful throne of a booth for those of us who are alive to enjoy it. jeez.  i'm giving you three stars though cause this IS a great place to dance and you have poppy jasper on tap.

jN0HkuvDARUjq2Wy-4GR6Q.review_text: Love the Boom Boom Room. Great bands not a bad cover. Great to people watch. Only downer, owner raised drink prices. I have know times are hard but 20 bucks for two shots of tequilla seems a lot.

9qHmguqVx8OQzmYoz1Lg4Q.review_text: I was there on Wednesday and the service sucked...I complained to the management but he was of no help...Dick!

euXjoscT73CKD3Ap0If05Q.review_text: This place is the SHIT.  sick live music and great mix of people..  hippies, clubbers, Fillmore date night crowd, a little bit of everything.  I'm here every chance I can get

zA1O6IIJdoc8QaDnn7oJIA.review_text: Went on a Saturday night with a great friend.  Opening band was hilarious and set a good mood.  Main act really jamming band but no lyrics just jamming felt like they could be more...  Negatives were the poser doormen and $20 cover -- I mean cmon what is that about? These are not exactly name brand acts and this is not exactly a concert hall -- rather it's some jam band in a stuffy hole-in-the wall bar.  Also the crowd was primarily middle aged men with more facial hair than deodorant and the only hot girl in the whole place was the bartender.  Had a pretty good time anyway mostly due to my company and not the bands or bar.

5mVsxXOzUUiWhdXf2TJtvw.review_text: First time here. Cool place, great history. It's a Wednesday night, so I am reviewing my Wednesday night experience. I wish I had drank before I came, or straight up brought my own booze. I have NEVER encountered such incompetent bar tenders. Sure, they aren't too hard on the eyes, but get a drink order right (maybe turn down the volume so you can hear straight) and charge your customers correctly. Beware of ordering anything with a red bull chaser because their lame excuse for over charging my friend, for the wrong drinks I might add, was they don't know how much red bull they use so they estimate and charge you based on the cans they thought they used.   I'll come back, maybe on a different night, and probably with drink in hand... Or in stomach.

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: Great space for a fun night!  My friend from college was visiting from Austin and we meandered over to the boom boom room after drinks at Harry's Bar.  The $15 cover was EXPENSIVE, but Topaz and Mudphonic band that played here last night was awesome!  Funk/blues/jazz type groove.  My friend ended up buying their CD.   My cocktail wasn't super stiff but not watery either.     Minus one star for the guy who was wildly dancing right in front of the singer.  By "WILD", I mean, busting out a Richard Simmons aerobics move then switching to the electric slide, doing the wave and just plain having a seizure on the dance floor.  I was waiting for him to do the worm dance but didn't.  SO disappointed!

86vCCRFtHJ5LamNmnCpTGQ.review_text: I've been here a bunch of times, and have never been disappointed by the music. They just get the grooviest acts here. This is not a swanky cocktail lounge. This is a bar that showcases great musical acts and serves reasonably priced drinks. I always find it funny that so many people can actually make their way forward to the front of the dance floor. How do they do it? We had a great time dancing in the back!  Anyway, John Lee Hooker would be proud that this place is still rocking. If you like good music, and don't need to shmoozed all night in a private booth or whatever, then you should definitely check out this place.  - 1 star for the low number of bathrooms. I know this is a really small place, but I'm female. Two bathroom stalls aren't enough when the place is hopping!

U13tLFucJNz1fNv_Xgdj0g.review_text: Yes, I like the Boom Boom Room. My friends and I went on a Sunday night over Memorial Day weekend and was luckily not packed at all, a welcome surprise for a dance club. Lots of good jams. And good times.

14MgvhliOMEjg9Q1uydA6A.review_text: This club is amazing and has some of the best live music in San Francisco.  My favorite band is KATDELIC, it's RonKat Spearman's band and he was the guitar player, vocalist for George Clinton's Parliament Funkadelic for quite some time.  He's HOT and his band plays at the boom boom room once a month.  go to this club and go see this band

TMWgq3KNRDaESXs8ZCrRtA.review_text: I really liked this place.  I can't believe I've been living in the city for so long and had never been.  I came here before my kickball game for Happy Hour.  Great deals.  $2 PBR and other beers.  There was a band playing that night and we were there while they were setting up.  Then they moved outside and started playing.  Pretty cool, never seen that before.  The bartender was really nice and accommodating.  I wanna come back when there's actually some jazz playing INSIDE :)

oW2bCSJ5bIHyRnoZvkHwDg.review_text: Members flagged my review, but Yelp elected to leave it alone.  I did not, and changed the disparaging remarks about the owner.  His actions speak for themselves sometimes... and other than that.. a fine, fine club.

7eo2hL7aKzJoLaWs8B2j_Q.review_text: JUST DANCE!  That's all I gotta say - JUST DANCE!

CSeWID1TbPxeFwaLRATjfA.review_text: Holy awesome!  Thank god a place like this exists.  It's like a little bit of New Orleans on the west coast!  I go to shows here a few times a month! All the great bands that come through play here and some have their after parties at boom boom and go until 3 am!  Most of the time they start on the late side but they will stay open after 2 (they will stop serving alcohol so get your buzz on early!).  Drinks are cheap, the crowd is great, and you're in for a great night if you come here!

e4Sek5hTjpe_eBeM9jXd6g.review_text: Sami, Laura & I grabbed some drinks here before seeing a movie at the Sundance Kabuki.  Well...not seeing, actually.  We got too schnockered at the Boom Boom to see a semi-serious flick.  But, I digress.  Boom Boom was decent.  I didn't love the smell of the place...and the ambiance wasn't all that great.  But, the Happy Hour specials were cheap and decent.  I adored the female bartender.  She was super cute, and I thought she was sweet.  Laura & Sami were not quite as charmed by her...I'm thinking it is a female thing.  Pretty girls do not like other pretty girls.  Kidding, ladies.  But anyway, a solid time was had by all.  I'd hit it again if I was in the area, but I prolly won't go out of my way.

zSVJRiet9pxTbYnETnJAVQ.review_text: I went to Boom Boom for Mardi Gras in the Fillmore talk about downright crappy.   As far as drinks, drinks were ok priced!  The doorman who checked our ID's was cool as we got in for free. We were inside pretty much a whole hour, but then all of a sudden me and my  friend went outside went to take a smoke break.   We noticed that the same doorman that let us in for free, was now charging people a $7 cover to go in.   Me and my friend didn't think anything of it as we figured we were gonna get back in because we were in the bar before.   NOPE totally wrong!   This "fool" was trying to charge us the $7 cover and we were like ummmmmm hello we were already inside. This guy was being a total douche (excuse my language). He said oh well anyone that's not coming in had to pay $7 and get a stamp! We were like DUDE WE WERE ALREADY IN there!   Homeboy never gave us any warning told us that there was event going on NOTHING!   We started to argue w/ him telling him that what he was doing was not right. He didn't care! He said your not getting in w/o paying $7. He was yelling at us too!!!   He said the $7 cover was for the band to get paid which we understood and maybe would've mentioned before or give us some sorta heads up that that would be fine! But nope!   Music and drinks are great, but the bouncers are d**ks!

GN4tSuRYSnOVA_VldNSTgQ.review_text:
Eclectic live shows. Reliably unpredictable jams. Mild-mannered bartenders. Raucous and high energy crowd -- yet respectful, with a pinch of polite and even periodic couth. Ok, maybe not couth, but definitely rockin' and always always a good time.  
  Good karma, great joint, old school. How  can you not love this place?

obzG4Rl--o2khekCBJ1R2w.review_text: Door guys are awful. $15 cover and I was $1 short and they wouldn't let me to get more cash after waiting in line for 20 minutes. Told me to eff off and go to the ATM down the street. Not worth your $15 or your time. Head down the street to cooler and more laid back places with music that are just as good if not better.

-t9kX5Ao9CM5QrwGI9YodA.review_text: Great club!  Perfect size and feel for seeing live music in my opinion.  Nice stage (they have a rising curtain!), nice staff, and great booking.. can't go wrong!

2TFc0YAo1RbUqx0A7w3GTw.review_text: Funk, Funk, Blues, Funk, and some NOLA Funk!!!

aCMV95HQs4NVsyIN0f_vlA.review_text: I had a great time on Saturday. We saw Hands on Fire play their Jazzy tunes with a mix of drums and other instruments I can't say I know their name. The Boom Boom Room is great for a night out with friends.  The drinks are preatty good and the atmosphere is a coazy little hole in the wall. Be sure to get in early to get a cool table. You can also dance if there is enough space.  I would love to go back again and enjoy their live bands.

EhFNfLJKWh__8_3NKrENCw.review_text: Don't let what happened to us here happen to you.   Ten minutes after we bought drinks, bouncers began clearing the place. When we protested that no one told us that we wouldn't have enough time to finish our drinks, the bouncers said that we could stay if we each paid a $30 cover charge.   Adding insult to injury, the overweight brunette bartender claimed that she sold us our drinks 25 min. before. Then a man named Aaron came, wearing an overcoat that was two sizes too big (we get that you bought it on sale but you still need to have it altered) and a pair of hipster glasses that kept sliding down his nose. He was such a bozo and so rude, my friends wanted to get out as soon as possible.

ilU2YC2DbzoxMUNjEZSpMA.review_text: I Love this place!! I recently moved to San Francisco. Leaving my girlfriends and favorite bars in LA.:) I found my new favorite place. If you like a good strong drink and Live Rock Music. This is one of the best local bars around. Tygre/ Bartender was this first Girl I met in the Citah! She is wonderful and pours a very NICE drink. The owner is awesome. I have met some really awesome people here. You should check it out!!!!! MUCH LOVE Boom Boom Room!!!!

HU3dY_PuMZF7x3H3_hhtig.review_text: Its a cool spot... Bouncers suck ass... Other than that.. Place was cool...
