u9o9kk6zmd3cz-vaxCKwJg.review_text: The guy working the door is a total jerk.  I will never come back to this place because of him.  We were there early having a drink before the shows were going on and left before the shows came on and this prick insisted that we pay $20 still.  Huh?  What?  $20 on top of the 5 drinks we bought inside with no entertainment?   This place robbed me!  Very un-San Franciscan!  I don't know who this door guy thinks he is but he's gonna learn real quick.   Anyway, I did give this place 1 star because Joe the bartender was a very good host.

46gdYGxNQOGL4E1UvLlamQ.review_text: GREAT venue, GREAT music, the guys at the door are HUGE assholes

rS4OEY7fWDZG_JuJjR9HWg.review_text: The quintessential dark cozy jazz lounge, I've enjoyed a good martini string at the small tables while enjoying a variety of music. It's a great little spot for after dinner in pacific heights

HR1wozuAE_3KAHFP1XvIjw.review_text: I can't believe I've never been here until a few weeks ago.  Oh how I am missing out!  We came on a Sunday evening and saw a fantastic band that I don't recall the name of.  (Yah I know, shame on me.)  The great thing about this place is the intimate atmosphere between the band and the crowd.  While it was really busy, it wasn't hard to make our way to the front and dance with a huge fan blowing air in front of us. You know how you go to a club and it gets so hot and sweaty?  Well that never happened here because of the huge fan.  Big props to the management for having that for both the band and the crowd!    If you haven't been here, GO.  You won't be disappointed.  Great people, great music and be ready to dance the night away.

tvGZBOnzYoGughdXZ8l4Mw.review_text: Sugar bootie !! there was this killer superbooty pagent there last night . What an awesome time .. Hot dancer girls on the bar, pole dancers , chicks swinging fom the chandeliers . The bartenders were awesome , the cocktail waitress was super smoking .. Jello Biafra was there and the guys from Big head Todd and the monsters . !! I met the owner too and he was super cool !.  I stepped outside for a smoke and the door guys had me laughing my ass off .. this place its great , its small and friendly and has an awesome vibe . its worth whatever they wanna charge !!!

TBRs3c6YSvfSKX6zLg1MNw.review_text: I loved the Boom Boom Room.  I went to listen to some sexy 60's soul the other night.  Bartenders were awesome and made sure I was doin alright throughout te night!  Clean ladies room with big mirrors and lights for those touch up we sometimes need after dancieng our tails off!   *becareful the cocktail waitress tried to over charge my friend twice for her drinks and another time she short changed me by $5.   But thats not gonna stop me from going to the Next In n Out!  I just gotta be on my toes!

-VepAtJE14U2E3Jl9wgsIg.review_text: Nasty, nasty place run by nasty, nasty people. Remember when this was a soul joint called Jack's? Well the soul has gone. The soul has gone away. There are many other venues to choose from  in SF that respect patrons and musicians. Go ANYWHERE else.

e1FuiYSV1v29q2OTR9ojBA.review_text: Interesting little bar on the corner of Geary & Fillmore, smack dab in the center of the Fillmore Jazz district...crazy checkered floor, pretty decent drinks, and they have some cool bands that come through and play live shows (if there's a show, be prepared to pay a cover).  Best part is, if you're stumbling drunk when you leave, there is usually a plethora of taxicabs available to take you home.    Most memorable moment:  it was the first time a chick ever came up to me and said, "You have really pretty lips.  Can I kiss you?"   Yeaaahhhh.....no.  I don't think so, honey.  I'm never THAT drunk.

KzrfdtTlGYX3tGflJ0JRbg.review_text: This bar is small, dark and cozy!! They have an ok selection of drinks. The prices are mediocre. The bartenders are doing an amazing job!  Would love to go there again!!

O82038wU3emRq0AXIUQs9A.review_text: We went in here because the sign in the window said "Happy Hour Everyday." After ordering drinks we were charged full price.  We asked about happy hour and the bartender said they didn't do happy hour on Mondays.  After leaving we rechecked the sign and it said nothing about happy hour not being on Mondays, it just said "everyday."  I went inside to give the bartender a heads up and maybe he should change the sign or take it down.  He just acted like a dick and said "it's only happy hour when i put my big folding sign out." Whatever won't go back.

mZokz37TaR5jFgMrx4WyFw.review_text: Great venue with fantastic music.  Reminded me of a more vintage version of the Temple Bar in Santa Monica.

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: Boom, boom, boom, I want you in my room... remember that song? Anyways...  I was only in this bar for about 45 minutes but think I can still review based on first impressions. I was psyched to see the "happy hour until 7:30" sign out front when I arrived. $2.50-$3 beers and $3.50 wells are great with me! However, when I ordered my cocktail at 7:20 pm, the waitress said she'd have to check if her cash register still thought it was happy hour (I guess its time often doesn't match the actual time...). Hum... luckily, the register agreed that I could have my vodka-cran for $3.50!   My kickball team met up here before our game and enjoyed the comfy-though-not-all-the-way-clean tables, bench seats, and chairs. A band was setting up which I would have liked to stay to hear but we had to play our game!  This seems like a super chill bar and would be a fun dive to come back to...

S2K0CKviY_F_2tdO9EfQxA.review_text: I went to The Boom Boom Room after a show at The Fillmore, that much I will admit.  I may or may not have spent time backstage after the show...  I may or may not have consumed a Jaeger Blaster upon my post- midnight arrival at TBBR...  I may or may not have danced to a live zydeco band...  I may or may not have witnessed a cute girl sensually playing the WASHBOARD and singing in the zydeco band...  I may or may not have swing danced to the music of the zydeco band with one of the members of The Fillmore show's opening act...  I may or may not have refused when another member of the opening act asked if he could kiss me...  I may or may not have seen the headliner from The Fillmore show at TBBR. He may or may not have been making out with a girl who was not my friend or me...  I may or may not ever return to The Boom Boom Room...

QtQrPd6YPJKNC7YG7G0LLQ.review_text: Best Jazz/Blues venue in SF.   Johnny Lee Hooker may be dead, but the music isn't.  One negative is that the place gets VERY hot inside.

sMOJxOkgk9VhKuXCBooXHg.review_text: Cool I guess. Lot's of history. Was looking forward to it. You know, you just have to have your expectations in place.  If you're looking for more than what it provides, you'll be disappointed. It's a cool place for what it is. And it gives lesser known musicians a place to strut their stuff.   I knew the band I was going to see so it was all good. But If I walked in off the street, probably not so much. Short story; go for the music and the venue itself will be fine. You may even be able to say you saw somebody there before they were famous. That's the kind of place it is. Fun.

a9RRUfSQ189nRvIEd6INWA.review_text: We came here for my fiancé's birthday party around 9pm on a Saturday. I knew there was a $10 cover that night (from the website) and all 6 of us were prepared at the door. When it was our turn to pay and enter, the doorman (wearing nerd glasses) told me it was going to cost each person $15 to enter the empty establishment. At this point, I was not interested in changing plans for the night, so I asked the doorman if my fiancé could get in free for her birthday, since none of us knew about the up-charge. He blew cigarette smoke in my face, as he told me, "well then someone should pay for her." I wanted so badly to verbally slam the doorman, but I didn't want to cause a scene, or organize everyone towards a new place (since we were there to see a funk orchestra and already had other friends inside). When it came time to pay, I handed the doorman $80 (for 6 people) and my buddy handed in a $10 to bring our total to the full amount. The doorman had a very hard time doing mental math, and got frustrated WITH US for paying together. He handed all the money back to me in frustration, and made each person pay him one at a time. What an idiot. I definitely won't be returning, due to the slow and inept service.  Overall, the only redeeming part of the night was the funk orchestra. Next time, I will see a show at any other venue in SF. There was nothing that really stands out about the boom boom room beyond what "Neck of the Woods," "Maggie McGarry's" or any other bar with a stage already offers in SF.

Q7rUXBBM_u5i7ZEEMq1tDQ.review_text: The two bouncers in front are not twins, or brothers.  They just alike and wear the same kind of hat.    I sat next to someone who reminisced coming to the Boom Boom when it was called Jacks like 25 years ago.  The pictures on the wall of the likes of Muddy Waters looking down, discerningly and slightly skeptically, were taken in this little place, where you can expect to wait until just about 11 for the music to begin, and expect to stay until 2:15.  By the end of the night I'll look back up at Muddy's picture and maybe it's just me, but he seems a little less skeptical.  Maybe there's a glimmer in his eye.  They're still bringing it.  Park yourself at stage left behind the keyboard, order a beer from the lovely waitress, and feel that funk.

yzAU4FV4s-tP9vurFXzIgg.review_text: i went there to met up with some friends.after being there for a hour some band started to play and i had ordered drinks and went outdside to smoke.as i tried to come back in they said i need to pay 15 bucks to come in.i explained that all my stuff was in a booth and i had been there for a hour and just ordered drinks.they were totally rude to me and my girlfriend and would not let us back in.then the door man tried to push my girlfriend and i lost.needlees to say they gave my money back for the drinks.this place sucks and the staff sucks also.i will never return..if i could give them negative stars i would..it  should be called the rude rude room!!!

5Mk4gwVCh1lBJQThhF4erg.review_text: This place reminds me of what "Fangtasia" from True Blood would be like.  Sets of original music played all night long. The band was great, wish I remembered the name.  The neighborhood did not look great - go with a group.

DlJ1EudYLOoqrjQA7tusjg.review_text: Great live show! The Funk Revival Orchestra performed when we went. The place is a trip into the past with a vintage 30's juke joint feel. We danced the night away...MUY CALIENTE!!

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text: a sultry steamy place with good loud music and fun crowd. we scored that private table by the window near the front door and watched all the drunk people dance. great venue!

wb2I6PxYjRStE7OGLL4S7A.review_text: Being a huge fan of live music and dancing I've always loved the Boom Boom room, because they over deliver on both fronts.This is a super chill, non pretentious music venue where you can let loose and be yourself. While drinks aren't any cheaper than your standard bar you never have to push through the crowds or wait very long to order a drink at the bar.   I was reminded of how fond I am of the BBR over the weekend. The night started off pretty standard: Happy hour after work for about 2 hours, followed by dinner with the standard consumption of drink 2 Goose martini's. After that we headed to see 'The Watchmen' at the Kabuki Theater where I continued my drink fest with another delicious Grey Goose concoction (or two).........Jump to half way through the movie where I return from the bathroom and ask myself  "What the hell movie am I watching?" At which point I decide to leave since I realize I'm less than half way through this 3 hour bore fest. I meet my man who's also coming back from the bathroom and head outside where we're approached by a homeless man who tries to get $5 out of us for a place to stay for the night. We decide instead to invite this seemingly normal man to the BBR with us where we manage to get him pretty toasted on 2 beers. I'm pretty sure he had quite a memorable night as he couldn't seem to remember the last time he had actually let loose and danced with a smile on his face for an entire evening. Success!  It was $15/pp to get in which I think varies based on who's playing that night. I won't say this is any better or worse than the Elbo Room in The Mission...so it just depends on what neighborhood you're in or if you actually look up ahead of time who's playing and prefer a certain type of music.

pyVk_h1IXVxp0YrzlGSf1g.review_text: One of the only ALWAYS reliable live music venues in SF.  You just cannot reliably hear music like this at many places in the U.S.  I'm talking 5-8 piece funk bands, with full brass players, and KILLIN' IT!!!    Some radio style funk like Bootsy Collins, Gap band, etc, but mostly high energy funk James Brown style with in your face horns, 70's type rare groove, as well as international flavored soul and similar flavors.  If you like B3 organ, this is only one of two places in the City that has a house B3 with Leslie speaker.    Started by blues legend John Lee Hooker and named after his most famous song ever.  This place oozes soul and to me epitomizes the best of live music that put San Francisco on the map world-wide many years ago and continues to hold up this reputation.  I hope this place keeps doin' its thing for decades to come.  I've got to have my Boom Boom fix at least every month or two.  If I didn't live all the way down in San Jose since I moved here 7 yrs ago it would be weekly.    I'm bay area born and raised and me and my buddy always get our live music fix here.  Been coming here every few months since 1998.  We were just there twice in the last 2 months and both times the music was great.  People in SF like live music and here at Boom Boom Room, people LOVE live music.  They really show their appreciation and respect for the world class musicians that hit that stage every week.    If you've never been here, do yourself a favor and get down there to see Will Blades or Oscar Meyer and Steppin', or just any friday or Saturday night will do, and prepare to be B.L.O.W.N.  A.W.A.Y.  Seating is limited along the left side of the long narrow room.  Get there by 9 or 9:30pm if you want a seat.  The music usually starts with an opener at 10pm and the headliner usually goes on around 11 or 11:30.  They often have shows where the music goes past 2am.  Most nights you'll feel like standing up and moving your body though if you have any soul at all in you.  To the left of the stage is a good spot to catch the action, right next to the rotating B3 leslie organ speaker!  Bartenders are cool, but it can get busy and it might take some time to get a drink at times.    Parking tip, park down Geary near the park a few blocks away.

_64q3QQbUg4BknYri7fCPA.review_text: boo. $15 cover on a friday night? really? thats how much covers are at BIG clubs... but okay...  then i went inside and ordered the usual jameson & ginger... the ginger was out and when i told the bartender, she offered me another drink, but it seemed like too much work for her to change the gingerale for the tap booo... i resorted to vodka

dBz_y-VGLlEr4IRrZq-zYg.review_text: One of my favorite stops on the way to The Fillmore. Make it an evening and drink your way to show. This place won't steer you wrong.

Uc2ZtQdTThtNSw_lNzfrpw.review_text: All it takes to drag me out of the Mission for a show at the Fillmore is a pair of free British Rock tickets and drinks at the Boom Boom Room. Most nights I would be that excited to grab a drink, but given the Hurricane that was SF that night, a Gin & Tonic sounded perfect.  Despite the more' being packed across the street, there was plenty of space to dance and move around. The bartenders weren't on their A-game that night as she didn't realize until I reminder her...40 minutes later, that she didn't charge me for my drink. That said, the drinks we're strong and got me into my dancing mood.   It was a great spot to get to know the new people in my crew that night and get ready for a night of jumping and headbanging.

xT15DPvgtyU799LLXpKzIQ.review_text: I dig this place at happy hour, the crowd is fun, laid back, spread out and diverse. It's a great place to see a small show, although it's not really my music scene. Catch a couple drinks here wandering around the Fillmore or Japantown. Note: $20 minimum on Credit Cards, that buys a lot of PBRs if you take that as a challenge. Fun bar and a really nice staff.

eQJtcM6rK0-x2F2UlZaNJg.review_text: Yet another bar that I've been to many times over the years and only now remember to review.  Not that they need one from me, this place is an institution.  It's always clean and has been renovated yet retains the vibe that makes it a classic Filmore haunt.  The bartenders are always great, the drinks are cheap and if someone is on stage chances are they're good.

N9FST4pCuLOgUu9GMixZ7w.review_text: Ah, the Boom Boom boom boom I want you in my room Room.  It's in a part of the city that looks frighteningly similar to Walnut Creek. However, it is deliciously UNglamorous. And if you go in at 5pm on a Sunday, it's also pretty empty.  John Lee Hooker used to own it. That's cool in and of itself. And there are cheap drinks, friendly customers, and good (and NICE) bartenders.  If I ever decide to pay $13 to see a movie at the Sundance Kabuki again, I know where I'm going for drinking before/after.

jJlYRJXPdIolKbuqGiZ-CQ.review_text: This place is a staple for me to start the night out before heading to the Fillmore.  We've seen some great bands from New Orleans play and danced our asses off many of nights after leaving the Fillmore.  The drinks are all cash only and no tabs allowed, so step up to the bar and be ready to go!

Cjns2nKBDH1WdZPP1jjtzQ.review_text: My friends and I stopped in there one night by accident and we loved it.  It is small and funky, but great atmosphere.  The band was incredible, Monophonics,  a funk soul band .  I later found out that they had won Bay Area Music Awards in their category for 2007.  WOW!  We will be back, but probably only when Monophonics are there.  What a night.

ZO0LU4unvbD7p32aTDQiIA.review_text: I like the atmosphere and space.  It's a cool place to hang out especially before a late movie at the kabuki.

LvdC1y5QlN9Ll3G7IVDXLA.review_text: The music was great, perfect lightening, nice red all around, the whole atmosphere is going on!  They put you in the mood for an extra drink...isn't it what we all want from a bar?

OnNmQjyBUECOa-cqbI_kAA.review_text: I never pass up an offer to be someone's backup date. Usually it means that they had tickets/reservations for something good, free night, and no undercurrent of sexual expectations (or else I would've been your 1st choice date)  After a night of watching Karen O gyrate and breathe heavily on stage at the nearby Fillmore, all I was in the mood for was some sweaty "pull my pants off with your teeth, knocking boots" or to wind down and fill myself with whiskey.   Circumstances had me choosing the later. The Boom Boom Room is a perfect spot for a pre/post Fillmore drink... or even a drink in general . I was looking forward to some Jazz but the night I went but it ended up being a Jazzy jam band. ALL bad. I was supposed to go there to chill out, but now I had ants in my pants and I wanted to dance, but the narrow space didn't allow for much of that.  Overall good place. Bouncers are a bit harsh but the bartenders pour generously.

tlsYH69VL0bEax4aM0uZ0Q.review_text: I would have loved to enter but the security person refused me. I turned 21 last week amd apparently, he said my passport was fake and I look young. I was not in the mood to figt so I left for Ruby Skye which was accomodating. :)

pvi_baolWn7mrtcb9rWAEw.review_text: When I moved to SF three years ago, my first apartment was about 4 blocks away from BBR... and am embarrassed to admit I was oblivious to this place's existence.  Boom Boom Room is overshadowed somewhat by it's larger, more prominent neighbors (The Fillmore, Yoshi's, Sundance Kabuki), and the facade doesn't really do the BBR any justice. But once you enter, it's like a different world.  I especially like how intimate it is - the red tinged lighting, fast friendly bartenders, staging somewhere between home grown and professional... reminds me a lot of some of my favorite venues in New Orleans (Maple Leaf, One Eyed Jacks). In fact a lot of great NOLA artists - not hue names, but people who's on the circuit - plays at the BBR, which is a major reason why I go there  I, unfortunately, have never been there for happy hour. In fact I've never been there before 10pm. But maybe, one of these days...

5lvfVuWaJPHx93fDQj-teA.review_text: The neon sign, the red pleather padded entry door, the deep red interior tell you its gonna be hot in here. The funk from Katdelic was even hotter. This place rocked. Small crowd just groovin. No tude. Just awesome awesomeness! Sound was great. Loud enough to envelope you but doesent make your ears bleed! Did I say I like this place?  Ok went to see FRO and Le Vice here on sat night. Awesome awesome awesome. Love this place!

VHdY6oG2JPVNjihWhOooAQ.review_text: Thanks for helping bring dub-step back to San Francisco.  My heart and soul really needed it last night.  With the slew of summer festivals popping up in the Oregon and Bay area - the once standard San Francisco dub-step parties - that would fill up my weekend and force me to make frantic Party Rat purchases at Great Stuff - have been on hiatus for awhile.Leaving my waistline aching for some good hip-roll music, and my spirit deflated - these past couple of weeks.  So when I heard that there was gonna be some dirty bass hitting beats at the Boom Boom room this Sunday - I decided to just go for it. I grabbed a late night cab over and had my five bucks ready.   The bouncers were chatty and ushered me right in. Into a familiar world of lovely smells, familiar faces, and oh so lovely deep sexy bass.  Moving in that dark - red-lit hazy room  - things just seemed brighter. Better.  The bartender - grabbed me a water right away and the quirky intimate-spaced Boom Boom - exploded with good music, as people pulled their hoodies tightly around themselves, pursed their lips and just got down.  No line for the bathroom, plenty of seating room, and best of all - plenty of room to dance. My worn boots - sliding around on the wooden floor.  I bolted early, but heading into the foggy chill of the now Monday morning - I didn't mind the wind hitting my flimsy t-shirt. It just felt good to dance again.  Trust.

_kSbuZlcen8sjeiVhKj4Fg.review_text: Good acoustics, good lighting, cozy red booths, and happy people.  All in all, a great venue.

RqUJo6tjD8m4JEuZ37VN5g.review_text: great spot for music in a kind of shitty neighborhood.  i like the dark, mostly red interior, and the funny drink names (for just normal beers on tap), but really it's all about the music.  that and the cute english bartender who happened to ride the bus back home with me and my roommate and we managed to somehow not invite to our houseparty....  dear bartender, if you ever see this, we wrote you a missed connection apologizing for not inviting you and once again, sorry--but next time we have a house party, you should come!

c8qFkI_VusWo0xZvkjfBWQ.review_text: I love this place.  I live right across the street and have been here more times than I can count.  Whenever you see a name in red on the marquee outside, make sure to see that band.  95% of the time I've never heard of them but they wind being incredible.    Funky Funky Funky.

9GCCoFw_UHiAHjZ4kygHgw.review_text: if you want to play handsies under a table at a candlelit spot with top jazz and blues musicians going off...this is your place. John Lee Hooker opened this spot and it has tons of history. I have also smooched and had handsie type situations go down here. RAD

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: MUSIC: Live jazz! JNG was the guest that night. :) Good stuff.  ATMOSPHERE: Like a regular bar almost, but with a stage at the end. Kinda roomy for dancing. Overall I like the feel of it. It's kinda basic, but nice touches to it. Like the stage had red curtains that'll draw up old school way, they had spinning lights from the disco ball, they had candles on the table in a red candle cup so there's red glows around the room, and a classic checkered floor. :)  CROWD: We went on a random weekday, so not super crowded, but just enough. People came as mostly singles or pairs. This one couple danced the night away, in a most entertaining fashion. haha. Age group was mostly 30+ I want to say. But yeah overall kinda casual upscale feel. (As to say there weren't ghetto people there)

W9BWCeuTjQH0TbFeuPB7Ww.review_text: Great place to see live music but please be aware that their dishwasher does not clean the glasses for sh*t and the place is SCOADY in daylight.  All I can say is stick to bottled beer at this place.  Period.  You might catch something other than a good show if you know what I mean.  I worked there briefly, trust me.

MjODtNdS1ZRskKS6CWbegQ.review_text: This place is great to see live music, it's small and intimate.  Do watch your belongings, I was robbed inside the venue.  It's a fun place but it does cater to thieves. I'd be back to see more live music but I will have a lock and chain on my things.

0_GsXlLu-uaXV0iZG3bMyw.review_text: Just as a heads up, Alex here has decided to appeal to yelp be claiming I'm unruly and was in his booth with my date. Also, I'd like to call out this event happened nearly a year ago. Interesting you claim you never got my mails/calls..I have records I can share.   @Boom Boom room  You're very wrong sir. You have me confused with another patron you threatened to kick out because their date found their way into the bar owners hands (on in this case booth). I hope you realize how idiotic and incriminating you look by coming onto yelp and try and claim I was drunk and that I was in your booth. My advice to you sir is simply review the 3 emails I sent on 10/12/12 and 10/13/12, if you'd like I can post those on this review as well.   Otherwise, I'd highly suggest making this right by admitting you don't remember this, that something like this happens in bars. However, don't try and gain support on yelp because you want to pull the "I'm an innocent bar owner" routine.

Fz3y-d7Ru7wMRnPuwG-OLA.review_text: This is a pretty low key place when there isnt a show going on. Ive only been here before a show at the Fillmore, to get my buzz on. Its a little divey, with a handful of colorful regulars. The barkeep is a sweet girl who tossed me a free shot for me just being a handful of carmel. I could see this place rollin hard, but until then, it gets three.

19I4YAfuhNtGQIjd2HDo5g.review_text: The Boom Boom Room is my go to spot for awesome live music.  Some of my favorite artists that play on a regular basis include Vinyl, Eric McFadden, and Robert Walter.   This place has a great atmosphere and the bartenders do an amazing job.  I highly recommend the Boom Boom Room!!  They go late night on weekends too so even if you role in after midnight you still will hear plenty of music:)

WjXzBDRVKMXs-PvFighu5g.review_text: I like to shake my booty here....yep!  I like to have drinks here....yep!  I like it freakin here..  So come here and find out what the hype is all about. It's fun.  Sincerely,  Staggering Drunk Fan

q4yMVuGp1JZW1n2eSleEvw.review_text: They had a great show on the night I went.  The venue was crowded, some girl in a tiny dress was dancing on the couch and people were laughing at her or ignoring her equally. The bouncers were hot & yummy & had just the right combination of style, speed, and flirtiness.  The drinks, well, I'm not really sure, I bought the tickets other people bought the drinks.  They have a great line-up quite often and I just need to ditch the early morning job so I can get out there more!   Seriously a great venue, the kind of place I want to go for music & revelry.  Not  a bar with music, not a studio with seats, but a place where you should get into the music and :) yeah it was good.

P8GPcx0hjENt8QpjGZOBqg.review_text: I had to leave a show (that I bought a ticket for) because there was so much weed smoke it made me super nauseated. If you like that kind of dive, fine. I found the $15 ticket a bit out of line with that mentality, though.

EjVRsZhNyG7vkCxVci7xHQ.review_text: Don't hesitate to walk through the door to the Boom Boom Room. The checkered floor, red flare, and narrow-rectangular shape make this place like an old time-jazz-possible burlesque-ish feeling venue. BBRoom is small and has one bar adding to the many reasons I enjoyed it.  Did I mention this is "the place" to score ridiculously cheap good music? I bought tickets for a friend and myself on a Thursday night. The tickets were $8/ea and there was no cover at the door. You can stand and rock out, sit at the bar and nod your head, or scoop up a tiny table that really looks more like a stool.    Damon and the Heathens put on a great show. They described themselves as a punk-jazz band, but they sounded Ska to me (only a little better). For such a tiny area the music sounds great. Maybe the walls just know how cool the music and people are at BBRoom. Drinks were easy to get. There are servers for the tables otherwise you can just walk up to the bar (the servers charge a little more than the bar).   The placed filled up throughout the night. Great venue and check out the website for upcoming shows.

Uqg8zgMw-JYJNpjVtFXqng.review_text: This is a fun venue. It's cozy and intimate.  The staff is friendly, the crowd is interesting, and the drinks are good! Plus, it's called the Boom Boom Room!

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: I stopped by here to grab a drink while waiting for a table at State Bird Provisions. It's a dimly lit spot with a stage which tells you there frequently is a band playing. If there's no band, the house speakers will probably be blaring out some music. There wasn't anyone playing Saturday early evening I was there. I guess that explains why there weren't that many patrons at that time which was good for my friend and I because we just wanted a drink to kill time and didn't have to deal with any waiting. Maybe I'll be back to watch some show but otherwise it serves as a cool bar. Prices were average.

yue6u7RgFayN9AkK4e3iMA.review_text: This place was amazing!! Caught a ghost was playing. Great staff and even better band. Had an amazing night!!!!

QHOlbQOLwri8pDHESDi_9A.review_text: Awe ____! If your girl likes to dance, this is the place to hit. Never a dull place!!! Whiskey SHOTS and beers.. If you like blues stop watching the newszz! Get out and check the sceen out.. you'll be back!

RETXrAIZtD2ckUMARJitFw.review_text: Was super excited to see the Brother's Grand play here and had rushed there straight from work. Was turned away because I had my work backpack, which there was nothing I could do about because I live a pretty decent distance away from the Boom Boom Room. Lame, screw this place.

oWJztclAau-xvN28lpXyIw.review_text: After being here on two separate occasions in the last week, I can now put my twosees in. 1. I'm all for small intimate venues that attract talented musicians.  2.  I'm all for small intimate drinking holes. 3.  I'm all for good sized dance floors.  4.  I'm also all for an after party venue after the party-venue (the Fillmore). Yeah, the Boom Boom Room fits the above bill.  Decent space, decent bathroom, decent pours, decent cover charges (if applicable).  Great bands that are funky and fresh.

h7p_nX7wBoczxWi-weIszQ.review_text: After living next to it for almost 2 years I finally decided to check out the Boom Boom Room. I wasn't thrilled with the band that was playing, but other then that it was a very good experience. Even though the place was pretty busy, we got our drinks within 2 minutes of entering the place, and even had a place to sit. I could have used some more booze and a little less soda, but regardless it was a good time. I wouldn't recommend it if you actually want to talk to whom ever you are with. If you are a fan of the hole in the wall music venue, than this is the place for you.

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: Sometimes I have make out sessions in a back booth, sometimes I revert back to high school and leave at intermission to swig baileys in the back of a friends car, sometimes I end up peddling the bands merchandise and sometimes I just dance to the great live music.   No matter how the evening unfolds I seem to always have a good time here.....and I seem to always see someone else who isn't having a good time. Lighten up people, put the fists down....we're all here to listen to some kickin music and get our groove on. It can't be that serious!

F4li3HnfS4gY5IeMSPkGcg.review_text: If you like live music and cheap drinks this is your spot.  While the jazz joints down the street offer better jazz options, the BBR is always fun.  Don't go here if you want to have a conversation though, because it's loud.  Do go if you want to get drunk, dance and meet some cool people.  I heard some reggae rocks guys place a few weeks ago and they turned me on to a new sound.  Who ever thought that Bob Marley songs could have sweet guitar solos and heavy drum work in them and still sound tight!  I'll be back at the BBR the next time I'm in the area.

zzr6MQqGgjkAEu6yTDK_TQ.review_text: Had a great time dancing to a cool band which consisted of a DJ and a drummer. Fun time good drinks. Will visit again

SZq4WeQXRFkU5JtesPjVkg.review_text: Perfect vibe, good booze selection, and a good mix of bands I like hearing.

RDU27joptNn9rPx4DfGgUw.review_text: Great intimate venue hosting some amazing acts.  Dive bar feel with nice interior.  Staff is friendly.  Finding a place to sit might be tricky.

a0AxvficFOemDMiaV2oYRg.review_text: Good time and the music is great.

2zvUWE9erOVhGn8lLzdzuQ.review_text: This is a damn fine venue, and there's very little I can think of about it to really critique.  The sound system is really good, it's got a fun, swanky look and is pretty comfortable, the staff in my experience are pretty cool...it's maybe a little on the long, narrow side and ends up being very packed up front sometimes, but otherwise I really can't complain about anything.  The funk/r&b niche that they mine means that it's often not exactly my scene, but that's no reflection on the talent of the acts they book.  It's a cooking little joint and the grooves here are pretty much always smokin'.  It's at least a lot more lively and fun here than at Biscuits & Blues, which is also good but suffers from a comparatively stiff, sterile ambience.  This is definitely a lively club and people come here to par-tay.  Shake that boo-tay, that is...

cImrKkWw8zGOWDQZ8nXKKA.review_text: The show was supposed to start at 9:15. We waited till 10:15 pm and were told it wouldn't start until 10:45 pm. I mean 40 minutes is fine, but 1.5 hours?! We just left.

1FRqbfhRZZWCQ9UZODlMjg.review_text: So I just got back from a fantastic night at the Boom Boom Room watching my favorite deep house band of all time Tortured Soul!!!!  Night was amazing when Tortured Soul finally hit the stage. The two douche bag guys before them were really lame and obnoxious. I couldn't wait for them to get off stage. I would of left and came back after their set, but I had good seats and didn't want to risk losing being so close in proximity to Tortured Soul.   The venue is a little small to be having a band with such a huge fan base. The bathroom is in the back and there's enough floor place for people to dance with their drinks. There is seating along the opposite side of the bar. Those seemed to get full pretty quick. There's a two stall bathroom for both men and women and a back door exit for when the place gets full.   There are ins and outs. At least tonight there was.   Despite the small venue and crowded scene, the staff here were amazing. The door man was so nice and the others were very attentive and on top of cleaning around the bar. So I'd be careful with leaving your drink around unattended.  The people that happened to come tonight were so great, friendly, and whatever is opposite of obnoxious. I had a really good time. At the same time we were all there for one purpose: Tortured Soul and you for to be a great loving, friendly person to listen to them.   Did I mention that Tortured Soul was playing?  The prices for the drinks were reasonable enough for my friends and I to go a couple rounds as well as buy the Tortured Soul some Tequila shots as well.  So my overall experience from tonight was 4 stars. One less for the small venue and the crappy duo DJ's who share one laptop. Oh goodness those guys were horrible. Actually if you see them, remember two young guys wearing sun glasses, walk right out. Trust me. Majority of my star rating is based on staff, Tortured Soul, and  the crowd that came tonight.

Vhm1eIhY6LMR7vwsgRyphQ.review_text: Boom Boom, thank god, is just a block away, so I can drink all I want and safely stumble home in an alcoholic coma. I did just that when I was lucky enough to catch Super Chikan at a recent show. It's not every day you see a geniune Mississippi-bred bluesman in town, and one who barks like a rooster and plays geetar with his teeth to boot. Anyway, every time I've gone, the bartenders actually seem to enjoy taking drink orders, so you're not left squished in between two barstools looking like a fool, waving bills at their backsides. A nice intimate club and I've always been able to get right up to the stage to see the action. Kind of like the laid-back atmosphere at Edinburgh Castle, but with the occasional transvestite in attendance. In any case, a far cry from the hipster clubs in the Mission and Tenderloin. Let's hope it stays that way.

Z7rKy3T5HETMznaZwk9zSQ.review_text: great happy hour, especially before fillmore shows.  $3 sierra draft $2 pbr, and decent well pours.  the sound system was also very tight, especially for the sound checks we saw before the truckers show.  Door staff was friendly, and let me roll in for a quick one after the DBT show ended.    bathroom was gross.  is it asking much to have a decently clean pisser at 630pm.

Ou6eJFvev_6yCXVMEhg1cQ.review_text: Awful security men at the door. This is the first time I've ever given any venue a ONE star! They hardly deserve a star at all..I will never go back, and I highly suggest going to every other place besides this one!

QjHj4rogqMBa8TXpDZ4Ctg.review_text: My favorite venue in the city, and I see a lot of live music.  Great, intimate room.  The sound is always incredible in there.  Seeing a good band is almost a sure thing on a Friday/Saturday night.  Drink prices are reasonable.    There aren't many annoying patrons, unlike other venues where you want to punch everyone in the room.

byUZpVzun-vVMMCFMXvdXQ.review_text: I would frequently pass this place to get to a friend's apt on Fillmore and always thought it looked a little rough and honestly, kinda ghetto from the outside. So, when I was told I WAS going out last night with a couple of friends, I was a little shocked that this was the place we ended up. I'm open to try anything once though and glad I decided to go for it. This is a little gem of a place and deserves a try if you're into live music, especially jazz and blues. The crowd was well mixed and I felt really relaxed here from the moment I went inside. No one judging you from head to toe, a really nice bartender (originally from New York), comfortable low lighting and a band that started to play about 10 minutes after we arrived. I had already been drinking and didn't try their drinks so I have no comment on the quality/strength of the drinks. I do have to say that I'm disappointed that they only take cash which, at the end of a night, can be a real drag if you're low on cash. Also, the band playing last night was not all that tight and at times I felt embarrassed for the lead guitar player. Being a musician myself and noticing the poor timing in their playing, I don't think I'd be into seeing this group again.  I look forward to coming here again and hearing some great music and most definitely getting my drink on! Cool spot!

FebHrRquAA6lQL_68-TriA.review_text: Update: I upped my rank to 4 stars after going back to the Boom Boom Room last night for a friend's birthday.  The cover was kind of a lot ($15), but the live music was awesome, and the place was packed.  Slightly younger crowd than before, yet it was still unpretentious and fun.  I checked out the Boom Boom Room with one of my roommates last night.    There was no cover (sweet) and the band played laid-back Funk/Jazz.  It was pretty mellow, not really packed (although we left at 10:30) and we got a kick out of the guy thrusting his hips on the dance floor with said lady suitor.  Drinks were reasonable.  Not a bad place to check out, especially when there isn't a cover.  I was surprised to see a mix of people at this place, be it age, social background, big groups/more intimate.  It was a totally unpretentious place.  Low light there, so hopefully you are good looking in candlelight... if not, this is probably not the place for you.

lRX1uoOWRRH424yFVAsDpA.review_text: Always a swinging good time! Every type of person from every walk of life, the BBR does not discriminate. Great vibe, the music is always loud, and the dancefloor is hopping! Memorable times here have included dancing with 10 different women, all in their 60s,  in a 3 minute span (what can I say, it was a great song!), watching new stars being born, and the day/night good ol' John Lee passed over. He is still watching over the Room and I know he likes it when you are nice to Phillip... you know, Phill-up The Tip Jar!

A2mx9xsHoIDNnd81_lxiFA.review_text: Great atmosphere for this cozy place! If all the bands are so good as the one I saw a few days ago, man, this is the deal! The only reason why I don't give it 5 starts is because the beers on draft are not that great.

VarPmrQsBeeLZ9suKpxYug.review_text: The Boom Boom Room isn't that swank, plush, all white decor, $100 cover kind of place. It's a dive bar, a local staple of an establishment in the "MO". It's small, it's in the corner of a busy intersection, with very little to no parking. It's right in the middle of two neighborhoods that are exact polar opposites of each other. But it's been bringing the same kind of vibe for as long as I can remember and it just doesn't play out.   The live music variety here is as flavorful as the best three course meal you have ever had. It's such a mix of jazz type performers, to hip hop artists known and on the come up. They can host orchestra ensembles or just a lone saxophonist. That's just the kind of blend they bring. The drinks are what you would expect. They have a few on tap and make just about any cocktail you can think of. They are decent in value. In fact it's damn near a steal nowadays.   What I really like about this place is that everyone is welcome. They know no colors. It's kind of small. It can get grimy and of course body funk is body funk but that's what this is about. This is where you hang with your boys or girls or both and just chill.   This is where you bring that first date and let her know that sometimes this is all you want. That sometimes you want to be in an old school non-hipster/emo kind of place where people just come in jeans and a shirt and don't mind that 48 hour no shower stench. Where the drinks don't have to be $20 a shot and you can just be grimy with the rest. This is the place where you will run into your boys from way back but you may also see their mom or dad or that crazy uncle. Yeah, this is the place and if she is going to be with you she needs to know it. And you know what? If she is going to be a keeper she is going to love it. If she doesn't, tell her to kick rocks and catch her own lyft car!!!

oAz4s21FA2QjE0kCNIDxOg.review_text: The Boom Boom Room is all that a blues club should be...dark, cloaked in red velvet, with free flowing booze. The live music is usually quite good, although the cover charge can be a little pricey. It's a great place to grab a drink before a show at The Fillmore...just show them your ticket, and they're waive the cover charge.

zT0PuDsIV-S7M-W_NaX9vw.review_text: Good place for music.  Can be a little hot inside... just like the music :)

n9-TyBEe3wx7s5weR9vraw.review_text: Very San Francisco, need I say more?

yMygl5-DYugYcGbqitXw2w.review_text: The Boom Boom Room is a rad music venue. It's in a fantastic location, just blocks from Japantown, The Fillmore, and Yoshis SF, and so easy to find, right on the corner of Geary and Fillmore. You can even walk directly into the Lower Haight if you don't mind a few hills and walking for 30-60 mins.  The bar has a very affordable daily happy hour with $3 draft beers and well drinks from 6-8pm. There is a strong selection of tasty beers on tap. There is no food served but there are delicious restaurants nearby in almost every direction and cuisine.  I must admit that I have only ever attended musical performances there if a friend's band has been playing. But after chatting with the bar manager, bartender and sound engineer, it is quiet clear that you will only ever hear skilled, talented and entertaining musicians at the Boom Boom Room. One band that I had the pleasure of listening to while there one Saturday night is RonKat Spearman's Katdelic. You have got to check them out.  I feel obliged to mention now my friend's band who you will likely see billed at Boom Boom in the future. Rubblebucket from Brooklyn, NY and The PiezoElectric Effect of Petaluma, CA.

g2oseja9mnTSA8Qq7GXqBg.review_text: Cool little bar that gets GREAT acts.  Fairly easy to get a drink.  If it gets full it is a little hot but any minor faults like like the temperature are more than made up for by the smoking good bands.

0V4B8A4tNArJp8aqDYX4-Q.review_text: Great little bar / music venue.  Good place to go before a show at the Fillmore.  You can get in for free if you have tickets to the Fillmore.

b8GIQtDZCEYIpSqNnaQqTQ.review_text: Shady dive bar is okay.  Shady dive bar with a $15 cover charge is not.

QbTEh6bdSHIRmUKvAT2BYg.review_text: This place would be totally awesome if it wasn't so expensive.  Cover of 5-20 bucks, 6 dollar beers, and a 20 dollar minimum for credit cards.  The music was great and it is a nice venue inside.... but it is pretty pricey.  There was one bartender working and the service was ok for me but every time my friends went up to get a drink she was busy chatting with people sitting at the bar.  I would love to support this place and I think it has a lot of potential.  It could be a great spot and would attract a lot more business if it didn't cost so much :(

CZ36wJqV-Xit758UaOr81A.review_text: Boom Boom Room is awesome. I'll make this short - GREAT live music, awesome crowd (mid 20s to early 30s), beautiful chicks who can really dance, decently priced drinks and the place is pretty big.   Only bummer is their $10 cover. Other than that, this place is totally my style. I love it. If you like to dance to a live band, you gotta check this place out. I've been several times and it's always been fun.

jW24T6R4_lSFUXQZEe2Jzg.review_text: This place is a San Francisco staple especially in the Fillmore area. Boom Boom Room is a incredibly small spot but offers some of the most intimate performances you can imagine because of it. There is a constant and eclectic rotating list of live bands each weekend that range from rock to rap to edm to everything in between. You never know what you are going to get and you really have to be in the know to actually have heard of most of the people playing but that's a good thing.   What happens because of this is that you only get the diehard fans or people who actually appreciate the music and they are out to have a good time. A live performance can be made or unfortunately broken by the people around you and its hard to run into that here. The dark lighting and red lights bring you back to the dive bars from the 80's movies and sometimes the bouncers are in fedoras so even better.   The staff was really friendly when i was there, a lot of locals and BBR enthusiasts show up so it can feel like a family gathering at times. Had a drink on a random afternoon waiting for a friend and it was a pleasant experience and even the Friday and Saturday nights aren't too crazy.   A great alternative to the big names and headliners at the Fillmore down the street but not as mellow as the performances over at Yoshis. A great place to get up and get on your feet and put your arms around an odd SF local or two.

1xZflgh5eGuKGtg7PlhNRg.review_text: FREE live music on Sunday nights?!?! And great music at that. No elevator tunes here folks. These musicians know how to rock 'n roll.   Happy Hour prices are unreal! I had three drinks and didn't break over $10. That's unheard of in many San Francisco bars.   Oh! And the bartenders are awesomely bad a$$.

5C9n2AJ-lft5eC1bTrl7Ig.review_text: Great dive bar.  We were there for happy hour before our dinner reservations at State Bird Provisions.  The happy hour specials were cheap and though the beer selection on tap was modest there were some great beers.  Even when happy hour ended the beers were $6 for a pint which is pretty good. They were gearing up for live music which we unfortunately missed out on. After dinner we went to Bourbon and Branch and I wish we had come back to the Boom Boom Room instead.

1p4wP0QzgdWXWYnRSR7MBw.review_text:
They always have great bands playing here from different parts of the country. Last time the Greasy Beats came all the way from Los Angeles, but the time before that was some hip hop group of people  from New York. The bar is long so you can just sit there and order one scotch, one bourbon, one beeeer.
  The first time I came, I just couldn't find it, and popped into Maurice the hair dresser, who also had no idea where it was. But he did say, if you can't find no boom boom down there..her ha! So if you need some, see my main man Maurice, just up the street. Jeez, people are friendly in this town.

EMRSUY3hkSje0zUx5Z9Urg.review_text: Three stars only if you do not have to pay to get in when there are no bands playing. We presented our Fillmore tickets and they let us in free but were charging others. I think this only works prior to the start of the Filmore show.   The interior is really retro, really red, dimly lit and like a flashback of sorts with good music playing in the background.   The bartenders are fast and the drinks were fine.   Agree with all of the other comments about the guys at the door. Do they think they look and act cooler than me (hum the song in your head). Really.

XMvEGq01mJmrbDGl17EP9Q.review_text: Good drinks (sidecar) and great music ! Get dinner on Fillmore and walk over for a show ($15 cover)

WF1o6AyXm6-NovD5dFnMOg.review_text: The last game of the regular kickball season came to an end last night and the Mighty Yellow team made sure to take a well needed pit stop at the Boom Boom Room before the game.  Granted I was only here for a brief time, I enjoyed the vibe, the bartender was extremely friendly, and the place had nice seating for the time being. The happy hour deals are fantastic, and for that reason alone received an extra star to 4.  Plus, they go until 7:30, so stumble in late or early, and drop the change on the table.   You don't really want to spend that on laundry do you?

D4JHDISAtHlnaHf4jtvj8A.review_text: Came here for a show on a Thursday night and it was not a bad crowd. Not too packed, but definitely a good number of people. The cover was $10 cash. Plenty of restaurants to choose from in the area. The bathroom oddly gets really hazy from the stage sometimes. Kind of trippy. Credit card only for purchases of at least $20. Also, they do not allow backpacks. They also don't have anywhere to check it either. So be aware!

uMVyvdgxgGqWwx44QTEB-Q.review_text: It was a friendly and inviting atmosphere, came and watched a band with no name play great funk. Great experience, the only downfall is there flooring. They need better flooring... Aside from that, this place would have gotten five stars :)

1PLvmn-kHIkLeaUvIh6QXQ.review_text: So I was in Japantown coming out of a Karaoke room because my roommate and his brother, both who are from out of town, were coming down to meet up with me on a Saturday night.   Me, being the native in San Francisco, had to play guide and think of a place to go.... typically, I would have just went back to the Karaoke room, but considering these are two white guys who are both over 6 feet tall -- I figured a tiny Karaoke room that was already packed with people wouldnt' have been the best idea. So I looked around and there was the Boom Boom Room and thought, why not...   And so, I walk over to the doorman, all pimped out with his zoot suit and brim hat, and find out that there's a $15 cover. I'm already kicking myself especially considering I have no idea what I am paying for. Okay, so I eat the cover and apologize to my guests, telling them I had no idea... Feeling guilty as hell, I buy a couple of rounds of drinks. Fortunately beers were cheap.   There was a jive band playing that night... they were actually very good. I appreciated the decor and dim ambiance. I also enjoyed that the people congregating by the stage weren't neccessarily dancing, but just rocking out to the music. It almost was like a small concert.   They also have candle lit tables with couches and chairs lined up on the side of the walls. Made me think this would make for a great place to take a date. On a side note, I also saw a guy rolling a blunt to the side on a table not having the least bit of concern, which illustrates the comfortable nature of the venue.   Overall, I'm grateful that I stumbled upon the Boom Boom Room... if any venue is representative of San Francisco, this is definately the place. Diverse crowds, great live music, a certain hipness but far from being pretentious, and of course, the smell of pot lingering in the air.

0tRJPLyfDJ-yUh1ZIJXH2w.review_text: If i could give zero stars i would. I DEFINITELY WILL NEVER RETURN NOR WILL I RECOMMEND THIS THIRSTY GREEDY ESTABLISHMENT TO ANYONE!  My girlfriend and I, along with my brother and cousin went to this place after outside lands this past weekend. It was saturday and they had a funk band playing seemed pretty cool. So we walk up to the front the bouncers who think theyre "cool" say $20. Fine $20 to hear live music sounds a bit high. Living in Los Angeles allows you to gauge nightlife vs other cities and this was no $20 worth show katdelic seriously, but fine, hey were on vacation. So we get in barely any people inside and its a small venue. The bar is basically at the entrance and though the entire bar has people along it no line was forming. Yet it took almost 30 min for my girlfriend to get acknowledged. Also overlooked for other people. When she finally got to ask the bar tender for a beer, boom boom room ale we heard we needed to drink, the bar tender said something that to me was desperate and thirsty and greedy. She said they were no longer selling beer. Only double shots of hard alcohol. What??? LMFAO!! Two people just before her walked away with beers. At this point we figured to let my cousin ask. Hes local he looks the part, nope! Same thing yet other people were getting beer. Now what idiot wants to drink double shots of anything and listen to funk? Just trying to enjoy some live music with a beer. One of two things could have happened here both with negative consequence to your business. First scenario. The bi**h bartender was being rude and did not like my girlfriend saw who we were with and told both her and my cousin double shots only. Two, they really were only serving double shots (far fetched because other people were purchasing beer). Either way we left. Directly after my cousin getting the same answer. The music was great but when a business acts thirsty and greedy its not really the establishment im trying to be in or associate myself with. I repeat If i could give zero stars i would. I DEFINITELY WILL NEVER RETURN NOR WILL I RECOMMEND THIS THIRSTY GREEDY ESTABLISHMENT TO ANYONE!   If only we could have ordered beers we probably would have ended up spending $100 each instead we end up spending $20 each at the door and going to another bar to spend more money, and realize how terrible an establishment it was. Sad!

BTzogObU2RFLCU56i8qdlQ.review_text: The boom boom room makes me happy.    Do you like live music? Do you like drinking? Do you like dancing?  Do you like staying out past two? Then the Boom Boom Room will make you happy too!!

NvgqhesWZQB23JPI5aedyA.review_text: Worst Door Staff I have encountered at any club anywhere. I don't know anyone who hasn't had a negative experience with this crew. I recently came directly from work to catch a friends show. They wouldn't let me in with my messenger bag which contained my laptop. Don't even think about making this place your second destination unless you want to pay full price to catch an hour of music. It's a shame as I'm a huge John Lee Hooker fan and I love supporting Fillmore businesses. I won't be returning.

ighhuf3rAKgKI2E-o9WDXA.review_text: WHAT??? I CAN'T _____ YOU! YOU ARE _____. COULD YOU TURN THE AMP DOWN??? I CAN'T TALK RIGHT NOW UNTIL the set (oh it's over).. OK now we can talk... Good, now _____ HOLY CRAP!!! NOW THEY ARE BLASTING A _____ CD DURING THE BREAK.   THAT'S IT ____ OUTTA HERE. BYE!!

hcKCRJ12EQwq3rQbhOprfA.review_text: jazz and blues in a narrow red room.  billowing red velvet curtains drop down when the band is in intermission - david lynch would like

D6ErcUnFALnCQN4b1W_TlA.review_text: If you like funk or funkiness or freakiness (music wise) or anything that sounds like that you'll really love this place.  I don't so I didn't.  But I gave it an extra star for the reasonably priced drinks, and extra star for the eclectic crowd, and an extra star for the contact high I got from the dude sitting next to us.

jnmczPEkhRsUFos_nBPjTA.review_text: After a month waiting to be in the right mood to watch Black Swan, I finally went yesterday at the Kabuki. So glad I waited - the movie is REALLY intense! I left with that 'I need a drink' feeling, and my friend and I were heading to his place nearby when we walked by the Boom Boom Room and when we heard the music we were literally lured into the place!  It was 5 o'clock on a Sunday, which meant no cover and happy-hour drinks. A beer and a glass of Merlot for $7! Great live music! Plenty of seats and room to dance! Met Zander, the owner, who was very friendly and fun! Could not get better than that!  I'm now looking forward to exploring BBR on different days and check out different bands! Movie and live music - no better way to spend a rainy afternoon in SF! :-)

NQ0REATs1_MehrNtnCaV2Q.review_text: Another cute, cozy little live music venue.  Inside it's built railroad-style, with booths along one wall, the bar along the other, and the stage at the far end.  I love the dim lighting (which adds to the vibe of cool funkiness), and the miniature dance floor in front of the stage is classic.  Apparently the booze selection used to be better, but it was still alright when I was there last weekend (both Guinness and Red Hook were available), and you could still get a $4 pint (as in a -real- pint, in a -real- pint glass.  'ja catch that, Bimbo's?????).  Also, the bartenders working that night were the kindest, friendliest, most helpful bartenders I think I've ever encountered.  One of them looked genuinely pained when he told me that they didn't have the beer I asked for.  Sound was fine; I don't remember it being particularly great or poor.  As an avid supporter of live music, I'd definitely go back for a band I was excited to see, but I do have to say that $20 seems a bit excessive for a place where the crowd probably doesn't break 100 people.  Other than that, a great time & a great venue. :)

Mq8Su0PZC8D4EaJrLJOhYw.review_text: Free live music on Sunday night was the draw - we love Jazz and the description of the music and the club sounded good.  It was a great joint, with red walls and comfortable seating - the bartender was delightful and really sweet. He made a great drink and I suspect the prices were fine...although I didn't pay - so I don't really know. The band was just ok.  I read up on the band (SNAKE PLISSKEN QUINTET) and it looked like they were going to be a lot of fun.  It turns out that they were just a Trio and had a guest singer...which was fine, but not what we were expecting. Overall, worth coming back...very neat space and fun crowd.

4qsVIa8wP0EDk86VogIs1Q.review_text: I used to love the place; great music, great scene...   In the past year or so, the bands that have been booked to play there are definitely sub-par and the drinks incredibly mediocre. I once had to return a martini THREE TIMES as they were putting in something sweet!

GKYUu0Qi6_Wnqv0CHAg0Cg.review_text: Good venue if the band is worth it, but once you factor in the terrible a-hole doormen and the pricey drinks from mediocre bartenders it kind of destroys the good time. Might be back if a friends band plays again, but even then I'll have to think twice.

fvPmgRm0qBs8gJHceqCduA.review_text: The place oozes with the smell of spilt beer and whiskey. I wish there was a cologne or deo like that because I would buy it (Essence de Boom Boom). The place itself is kind of a cinder block trailer with a bar on the right and a stage at the end. But it's really a magical trailer. No dancing bears or elephants in the band but sweet music coming off of that tiny stage. It's a throw back to an older Fillmore. Less pretension more passion and focus on music. It can get really hot and stuffy in there sometimes but you gotta 1. Suck it up and take in the music or 2. Take your frumpy, picky behind elsewhere. The drinks are rather cheap. Well, at least not close to the extortion prices encountered in other venues. When I was a kid the boom boom room referred to a very different kind of boom boom. They take care of the music boom boom here and leave the rest up to you.

olEYaQziRperfA9b5HhOuA.review_text: Great club, unfortunately, I have to remove stars because the bartenders are slow and condescending.  They apparently don't understand quick service with a smile gets them bigger tips.    It's a shame because other wise this place is worth a trip.

O_L3nw57ccPpovGlYFOKLw.review_text: THIS PLACE IS AWFUL!!!!  THE ABSOLUTE WORST EXPERIENCE I'VE HAD AT ANY CLUB OR RESTAURANT IN SF.  It's a tiny, poorly ventilated, smelly hole in the wall with a sticky floor.    I went to the manager for help and he was not in the least bit interested in customer satisfaction.  A short, bald,condescending man wearing a 3-piece suit that I think made him feel important.  (If you're reading this, until you learn to tie a tie, it just makes you look like a fool.)  The management could not care less about their own customers.  You can do much better at any other club!!!  Or just staying home.

E-ws0CUwkAYlv5JEfRr9mA.review_text: My life has changed since I started to hang out at The Boom Boom Room. It's one of my favorite places to have a pre or a post party. Meeting some friends for drinks this evening? Nothing better to start your evening with a chilled Boom Boom Ale. A fantastic old school jukebox will keep you eyes glued to the screen - but you may not be able to hear the tunes, coz it's got a mind of it's own. Usually the bands will start around 10PM and they have live music Tuesday thru Sunday. Sometimes a sea of people will just walk in from The Fillmore next door - whoa flash mob party! If you got the blues, come to the boom boom! And if your party ended early, like midnight, there is no better place to go grab a drink and get your groove on than the Boom Boom.  Very hip and young crowd - excellent place for live jazz, blues and funk. You will always see me there ;)

_c50WkYV9C2XieD8blXBUA.review_text: This place was pretty cool, live band, interesting people and reasonably priced drinks.  Though the music was not my type of music, I can appreciate the fact that the band was talented and well liked due to the crowd participation.  I definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves blues and funk!

jIyAOAsmNjGScVj-2bwUGg.review_text: Cool spot in SF. Great live music. Great vibe. Average selection of drinks. Will go back when in SF again.

eu19K9KfnvvubzWuv4l6Wg.review_text: Booty-shakin', earth-quakin', heart-thumpin', bass-bumpin'......that's what goes on at the Boom Boom Room.   Thigh-rubbin', lip-smackin', drink-swiggin', pre-gamin'...that's what goes on at the Boom Boom Room.  So much good music, fun, feel good funky music in such a cozy venue.  Free before 10 with a ticket to the Fillmore, this is a great place to start your evening....and there is usually music late night, so you might as well end your evening there too.  Definitely a hidden treasure in a neighborhood with a bad reputation.

5Kdb0ciGON6EHNUeFmrjEg.review_text: i love the boom boom.  i used to live near it and would roll solo on a random weeknight and never be disappointed with the band (or the crowd or even the staff for that matter).  ok, i do have one complaint.  i still to this day have never been allowed the privilege of sitting in mr. hooker's perfectly situated round booth.  it looks oh so perfect for a party of 4 or so.  but then again i've never seen anyone else in it either...

XhCk6GU4Lf9xicTS9a4wVA.review_text: On Saturday night I went to the Boom Boom Room to see Chum. I took a $20 cab there as I knew I'd be drinking. When I arrived, I was greeted by one of the largest egos I've ever encountered working the door. I was wearing a novelty yoda backpack and was advised there was a no backpack policy in a very rude manner as I was trying to pay the $15 cover. I explained it was my purse and I'd be happy to show him the 4 contents inside it as I had just paid $20 to get there and was meeting a group of friends out. He replied, "no backpacks". I understand the concept behind that rule, but my "backpack" was literally smaller than most  women's purses and I offered to check my bag, at which time I was advised, "no backpacks". Just then my 2 friends arrived, at which time the 3 of us left and went to another establishment and each spent the $100 we were going to spend elsewhere. This establishment used to be one of my favorite bars in the city! Until the boom boom room invests in a new doorman with less of an ego, my friends and I will be spending our money elsewhere.

1W86dgJ8g-CS1j9wMQ66HQ.review_text: This place is so effing amazing! Cant believe I havent posted a review yet. So they have live music which rocks and have a little dance floor to get your groove on. Gets super crowded as the night progresses, you get in for free before 9. If you like soulful music and jazz then go! This place is a rare gem and wont disappoint!

eNn5YANO-vSxSlVjs34Ivg.review_text: So, i'm picky w/ venues and this one squeaks by in my approval book.  Im not running to the doors, but don't get too amped to see my favorite acts there.  Sound is good enough, but no Independent.  Drinks are fair enough, w/ average bar service.  Covers can be a little high, but normally for a long ass show.  Sometimes a great place to hit up after a fun night at the Fillmore, as well.

Er0hnraJKQ8qpWOHg_iYVA.review_text: Good place to see a show just DON'T bring any sort of bag unless you want a f@%king huge hassle when you get to the door. Oh and don't count on being able to use your CC either - cash is king at the BBR...

n04Uh_28nFGskcDHoeGUrQ.review_text: While I enjoyed the energy and music of the Boom Boom Room on New Year's Eve, I have a few bones to pick:  Although the venue's site said the cost was $40 in advance, once I connected online, I was charged $50. I called the Boom Boom Room the day before and spoke with the manager who said he would give me free drink coupons when I arrived. He refused to and pretended he did not remember the call. All and all, I am out an additional $20.  In addition, I did not see one exchange of money as the door, which led me to believe that many people did not have to pay depending upon what time they arrived.  The whole payment system does not sit well with me.

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: As much as I've always loved the Boom Boom room, I was disappointed that they showed their true colors at the Fillmore Jazz Festival this weekend.  At most a two-count on the drinks (I was a bartender for many years. When we asked them to re do it or top it off they said, it tastes like that because it is so big. kind of insulting).  That's like getting a $10 drink at Cat Club on a Thursday night before 10 PM.  just wrong.  To be fair, one bartender was nice enough to give my better half a top for both our drinks (but was immediately chastised by the other bartender).  Disappointing after the amount of money we've spend here over the years.  Not sure if I'll return after all these years.  we'll see.

aG4WUZzOX0oT31fw7HzwEg.review_text: I love the Boom Boom! Alex -  the owner of the place,  is to be commended for bringing the REAL music from New Orleans to SF! Great acts bring the A game to this place, and some serious music fans come to groove and boogie hard. Musicians know that this gig is one where ya have to do it - and they usually do.  The staff there are always really nice to us when we're there.  It gets seriously hot on the dance floor - but that adds to the fun.  Its a great no-attitude place. Highly recommended

WtRwwfPkoqoJ5GlyUVoE_g.review_text: My sister and I went there randomly one night and Ron Kat was playing. Enough said! He reminded me of Prince. Thank you Jesus!

r4IuUsNnZOeklVaph9SGvA.review_text: I'm ashamed that I've been living in SF for 6+ years now and I'd never stepped foot in the Boom Boom Room until last night.  I met up with a friend for a drink before heading over to see Mutemath at the Fillmore. And I'll be going back to spend an evening here!  The red vinyl, the swinging jazz, the stage and the dancefloor! I'm intrigued. And the drinks were cheap!

3c3w_jRC2PwrA2MmC7ChGQ.review_text: I've never actually been here to see a show before, so I can't comment on the nightclub environment here.  Instead, I come here a couple of times a month during the happy hours to grab a few quick drinks and then be on my way.  It's kind of a hidden gem in that regard.    There's never more than a handful of people there, and the drinks are suitably cheap.  Although it seems like the jukebox is always on the fritz, the bartenders usually have good enough taste in music that one of their ipods plugged into the PA is an adequate substitute.    The atmosphere is very laid back and friendly, and it's easy to strike up a conversation with whomever is sitting next to you at the bar.  Since it seems to draw a musically-oriented crowd, music is a pretty good bet as a starter topic.  There are no tvs inside, so you can't watch the game or whatever, but that just puts the focus back on the people around you.    The Boom Boom Room is a brilliant, quiet alternative to the noisier, more polished "watering hole" establishments elsewhere in the neighborhood, especially during that crucial 5pm to 8pm window of opportunity.
